will never frighten quoth yeo bog captain tut devonshire men heath trotter born not know way over peat moor three strode away splashed scrambled for quarter of mile to knoll while cry became louder louder a neared be ghost otter sir true irish howl a captain leigh said will warrant master shamus knew a much long ago said yeo in fact must now hear plainly ochone ochonorie of wild woman scrambling over boulder of knoll in minute came full upon be young girl sluttish unkempt of course fair enough only covering a usual be ample yellow mantle there sat upon stone tearing black dishevelled hair now then throwing up head bursting into long mournful cry for world a yeo said like dumb four footed hound not christian soul on knee lay head of man of middle age in long soutane of romish priest one look at attitude of limb told that be dead two paused in awe raleigh spirit susceptible of poetical image felt keenly that strange scene bleak bitter sky shapeless bog stunted tree savage girl alone with corpse in utter desolation a bent head over still face called wildly to who heard not then utterly unmindful of intruder sent up again that dreary wail into dreary air felt sacred horror almost made turn away leave unquestioned yeo whose nerve be of tougher fibre asked quietly will go search fellow captain better think said amyas raleigh went gently to girl spoke to in english looked up at armor plume with wide wondering eye then shook head returned to lamentation raleigh gently laid hand on arm lifted up while yeo amyas bent over corpse be body of large coarse featured man wasted shrunk a if by famine to very skeleton hand leg be cramped up trunk bowed together a if man have died of cold famine yeo drew back clothes from thin bosom while girl screamed wept made effort to stop ask who be yeo know little irish said amyas asked girl made answer stubborn jade wo tell of course sir if be man 'd make soon enough ask who killed one say believe say true for can find wound man have be starved sir a be sinful man god help though be priest yet seems full enough down below what be here big pouch sir stuffed full of somewhat hand hither two opened pouch paper paper scrap of food then parchment unrolled latin said amyas must construe don scholar be possible said raleigh after reading moment be indeed prize be saunders yeo sprang up from body a if have touched adder nick saunders legacy sir nicholas saunders legate villain why did not wait for to have comfort of killing dog kicked corpse with foot quiet quiet remember poor girl said amyas a shrieked at profanation while raleigh went on half to yes be saunders misguided fool be end to thou hast come with thy plotting thy conspiring thy lying thy boasting consecrated banner pope bull deis holy water blessing of saint angel thy lady of immaculate conception thou hast called on heaven to judge between thee here be answer what be in hand amyas give pastoral epistle to earl of ormond noble of realm of ireland who groan beneath loathsome tyranny of illegitimate adulteress etc nicholas saunders by grace of god legate etc bah forsooth be thy last meditation incorrigible pedant victrix causa diis placuit sed victa catoni ran eye through various other document written in usual strain full of huge promise from pope king of spain frantic filthy slander against elizabeth burghley leicester essex elder sidney great good man never mind of party who then upheld commonweal bombastic attempt to terrify weak conscience by denouncing endless fire against who opposed true faith fulsome ascription of martyrdom sanctity to rebel traitor who have be hanged for last twenty year wearisome argument about bull in caena domini elizabeth excommunication nullity of english law sacred duty of rebellion right to kill prince impenitently heretical like insanity villainy may be read at large in camden phoenix britannicus fox martyr surest of in writing of worthy with gesture of disgust raleigh crammed foul stuff back again into pouch taking with walked back to company then remounting marched away once more towards land of desmonds girl be left alone with dead hour have passed when englishman be standing by wailing girl round dozen shockheaded kernes skene on thigh javelin in hand be tossing about tawny rag adding lamentation to of lonely watcher englishman be eustace leigh layman still still at old work by two year of intrigue labor from one end of ireland to other have be trying to satisfy conscience for rejecting higher calling of celibate for mad hope still lurked within fiery heart brow be wrinkled now feature harshened scar upon face slight distortion accompanied be hidden by bushy beard from never forgot for day forgot who have given to have be with desmond wandering in moor moss for many month in danger of life now be on way to james fitz eustace lord baltinglas to bring news of desmond death with remnant of clan who be either too stout hearted too desperately stained with crime to seek peace from english a fellow did find at once freely there eustace stood looking down on be left of most sacred personage of ireland man who a once have hoped be to regenerate native land bring proud island of west once more beneath that gentle yoke in united christendom labored for commonweal of universal church there be with eustace dream in very heart of country have vowed believed a vowed be ready to rise in arm a one man even to baby at breast so have said in vengeance against saxon heretic sweep hated name of englishman into deepest abyss of surge walled coast with spain pope to back wealth of jesuit at command in midst of faithful catholic valiant soldier nobleman who have pledged to die for cause serf who worshipped a demigod starved to death in bog be pretty plain verdict on reasonableness of expectation not to eustace leigh be failure of course be accident indeed to have be expected in wicked world whose prince master a knew be devil indeed proof of voyager who have combined knight errantry of middle age with practical prudence of modern dared for duty more than cortez pizarro dared for gold amyas simple fellow took in greedily knew enough of long a lived that effectually prevented child after from falling into temptation thereunto incident between one of bridge trustee arose argument whether salmon caught below bridge be better worse than one caught above a weighty question must only be decided by practical experiment mr st leger vowed that a bridge have given good dinner must give bridge one offered bet of five pound that must find out of pool below annery a firm flaky salmon a appledore one have just eaten then in fulness of heart invited whole company present to dine with at annery three day after bring with wife daughter don guzman being at table be invited too so there be mighty feast in great hall at annery such a have seldom be since judge hankford feasted edward fourth there while one be eating best drinking worst rose salterne don guzman be pretending not to see other watching other more rose at least have to be very careful of glance for not only be father at table just opposite sat none other than messrs william cary arthur st leger lieutenant in majesty irish army who have returned on furlough few day before rose salterne spaniard have not exchanged word in last six month though have met many time spaniard by mean avoided company except in father house only took care to obey carefully by seeming always unconscious of presence beyond stateliest of salute at entering departing took care at same time to lay out to very best advantage whenever be in presence to be more witty more eloquent more romantic more full of wonderful tale than ever yet have be cunning don have found foiled in first tactic be now trying far more formidable one in first place rose deserved very severe punishment for having dared to refuse love of spanish nobleman what greater punishment must inflict than withdrawing honor of attention sunshine of smile there be conceit enough in notion there be cunning too for none knew better than spaniard woman like world be pretty sure to value man especially if there be real worth in at own price that more demand for more will give for now must put high price on pique pride a be too much accustomed to worship to be won by flattering might have done by paying attention to one else be too wise to employ so coarse method might raise indignation disgust despair in rose heart must have never brought to foot a will never bring woman worth bringing so quietly unobtrusively showed that must do without poor fool a be meant to do began forthwith to ask why what be hidden treasure what be reserve force made independent of while must not say that be independent of have secret how pleasant to know huge ambition how pleasant to share in mysterious knowledge how pleasant to learn capacity of love beyond common how delicious to have for own must be greater wiser richer hearted than be a well a better born ah if wealth must supply poverty so step by step be being led to sue in forma pauperis to very man whom have spurned when sued in like form to temptation of having mysterious private treasure of being priestess of hidden sanctuary being able to thank heaven that be not a other woman be be becoming fast too much for rose a be too much for most for none knew better than spaniard how much more fond woman be by very law of sex of worshipping than of being worshipped of obeying than of being obeyed how coyness often scorn be mask to hide consciousness of weakness mask too of will often be first to tire rose be utterly tired of same mask a sat at table at annery that day don guzman saw in uneasy downcast look thinking conceited coxcomb that must be guzman taking seat in midst with proud humility at lady grenville foot began perfection fair illustrious lady must doubtless have heard ere now how sebastian cabota forty five year ago sailed forth with commission from late master emperor charles fifth to discover golden land of tarshish ophir cipango being in want of provision stopped short at mouth of mighty south american river to gave name of rio de la plata sailing up discovered fair land of paraguay may not have heard how on bank of river at mouth of rio terceiro built fort men still call cabot tower have perhaps heard of strange tale will ever make tower sacred spot to true lover for when returned to spain year after left in tower garrison of hundred twenty men under command of nuno de lara ruiz moschera sebastian da hurtado old friend fellow soldier of invincible grandfather don ferdinando da soto with jewel than spain never possessed one more precious lucia miranda wife of hurtado who famed in court of emperor le for wisdom modesty than for unrivalled beauty have thrown up pomp ambition of palace to marry poor adventurer to encounter with hardship of voyage round world mangora cacique of neighboring timbuez indian with whom lara have contrived to establish friendship cast eye on fair creature sooner saw than coveted sooner coveted than plotted with devilish subtilty of savage to seize by force what knew must never gain by right soon found out passion be wise enough what woman be not to know when be loved telling husband kept a much a must out of new lover sight while savage pressed hurtado to come visit to bring lady with hurtado suspecting snare yet fearing to offend cacique excused courteously on score of soldier duty savage mad with desire disappointment began plotting against hurtado life so went on several week till food grew scarce don hurtado don ruiz moschera with fifty soldier be sent up river on foraging party mangora saw opportunity leapt at forthwith tower lady a have heard from who have seen stand on knoll at meeting of two river while on land side stretch dreary marsh covered with tall grass bush fit place for ambuscade of four thousand indian mangora with devilish cunning placed around tower while went boldly up to followed by thirty men laden with grain fruit game delicacy forest must afford there with smiling face told unsuspecting lara sorrow for spaniard want of food besought to accept provision have brought be a have expected invited by lara to come in taste wine of spain in went thirty fellow bandit feast continued with song libation far into night while mangora often looked round at last boldly asked for fair miranda have shut into lodging pleading illness plea fair lady little availed that hapless dame for sooner have spaniard retired to rest leaving by know not what madness mangora indian within than be awakened by cry of fire explosion of magazine inward rush of four thousand from marsh outside why pain gentle ear with detail of slaughter few fearful minute sufficed to exterminate bewildered unarmed countryman to bind only survivor miranda innocent cause of whole tragedy four other woman with infant to lead away in triumph across forest towards indian town stunned by suddenness of evil have passed still more by thought of worse be to come a too well foresaw miranda travelled night through forest be brought in triumph at day dawn before indian king to receive doom judge of astonishment when on looking up saw that be not ray of hope flashed across asked where be 'he be slain last night ' said king 'and brother siripa be now cacique of timbuez be true lara maddened with drink rage wound have caught up sword rushed into thick of fight singled out traitor slain on spot then forgetting safety in revenge have continued to plunge sword into corpse heedless of blow of savage till fell pierced with hundred wound ray of hope a said flashed across wretched miranda for moment next found that have be freed from one bandit only to be delivered to 'yes said new king in broken spanish brother played bold stake lost be well worth risk showed wisdom thereby can not be queen now must content with being mine ' miranda desperate answered with fierce taunt must invent against treachery crime asked how came to dream that wife of christian spaniard must condescend to become mistress of heathen savage hoping unhappy lady to exasperate into killing on spot in vain only prolonged thereby own misery for whether be lady that novel sight of divine virtue beauty awed a may have awed ere now where have just before maddened whether dream crossed savage a may have crossed ere now that must make wisdom of mortal angel help ambition a well a beauty happiness whether will never believe of one of dark child of devil though can boldly assert of spark of boldness within made too proud to take by force what must not win by persuasion certain be a indian confessed afterwards that savage only answered by smile bidding men unbind told that be slave of that only lay with to become sovereign of vassal assigned hut to herself loaded with savage ornament for several week treated with le courtesy so miraculous be power of love than if have be cavalier of castile three month more lady a have heard passed in misery day miranda grew more desperate of deliverance saw staring in face nearer nearer hideous shameful end when one day going down with wife of cacique to draw water in river saw on opposite bank white man in tattered spanish dress with drawn sword in hand who have sooner espied than shrieking name plunged into stream swam across landed at foot clasped in arm be other lady incredible a may seem than don sebastian who have returned with ruiz moschera to tower found only charred bloodstained heap of ruin guessed a by inspiration what have passed whither lady be gone without thought of danger like true spanish gentleman true spanish lover darted off alone into forest guided only by inspiration of own loyal heart found again treasure found still unstained own who can describe joy who again terror of meeting indian woman have fled in fear for short ten minute that lover be left together life to be sure be one long kiss what to do knew not to go inland be to rush into enemy arm must have swum with across river attempted strength worn out with hunger travel failed drew with difficulty on shore again sat down by to await doom with prayer first last resource of virtuous lady a weapon be of cavalier ala for may no true lover ever have to weep over joy so soon lost after having be so hardly found for ere quarter of hour be passed indian woman who have fled at approach returned with warrior of tribe don sebastian desperate must fain have slain wife on spot hand sank again whose must not indian a raised against fair faithful breast in few minute be surrounded seized from behind disarmed carried in triumph into village if can not feel for in misery fair lady who have known sorrow yet prisoner can don guzman paused moment a if overcome by emotion will not say that a paused did not look to see if rose salterne eye be on a indeed be yes can feel with can estimate better than lady greatness of love must submit to captivity to loss of sword to loss of honor next to god mother be true spaniard deity there be who have suffered that shame at hand of valiant gentleman again don guzman looked up at rose yet must have sooner died thousand death dared to endure from hand of villain savage heathen for be true spaniard therefore true lover will go on with tale wretched pair then a have be told by ruiz moschera stood together before cacique like true child of devil comprehending in moment who don sebastian be laughed with delight at seeing rival in power bade bind at once to on head just vengeance of heaven wrought even on heart nevertheless pleasure of seeing who have so long scorned suppliant at foot be too delicate to be speedily foregone not till be blind with tear with broad lofty forehead wrinkled with study eye weakened by long poring over crucible furnace lady have once be comely enough be aged worn a sailor wife be apt to be by many sorrow many sad day have have already for although john hawkins port admiral of plymouth patriarch of british shipbuilder be faithful husband enough a ready to forgive a be to quarrel yet be obstinate ruthless in spite of religiosity for men be religious then be by mean consistent walker sadder day be in store for poor soul nine year hence must be asked to name son brave new ship must christen repentance giving reason armada for coxcomb have father heart in after prisoner wounded ruined languishing for weary year in spanish prison sadder day than be in store when gallant fleet must round ram head not with drum trumpet with solemn minute gun flag half mast high to tell that terrible husband work be done terrible heart broken by failure fatigue body laid by drake beneath far off tropic sea if at close of eventful life one gleam of sunshine opened for while when boy richard returned to bosom from spanish prison to be knighted for valor made privy councillor for wisdom yet soon how soon be old cloud to close in again above until weary eye must open in light of paradise for son dropped dead say at very council table leaving behind naught broken fortune huge purpose never be fulfilled stormy star of bold race be set forever lady hawkins bowed weary head died groan of stolen negro ringing in ear having lived long enough to see husband youthful sin become national institution national curse for generation yet unborn know not why opened heart night to adrian gilbert with frankness must hardly have dared to use to own family perhaps be that adrian like great brother humphrey raleigh be man full of lofty delicate enthusiasm tender poetical such a woman cling to when heart be lonely so be adrian half ashamed of own ambitious dream sate looking at while in silence then lord be with dearest lady strange how woman sit at home to love suffer while men rush forth to break heart yours against rock of own seeking ah well be not for scripture must have thought that adam rather than eve have be one who plucked fruit of forbidden tree woman fear did deed nevertheless for bear doom of life long always remind madam of dear mr leigh of burrough counsel do see often hear of a one of lord most precious vessel must have done more ere now than see said with blush have allowed life only for memory of husband fame of noble son a spoke door opened in walked wrapped in rough sea gown none other than one of said noble son adrian turned pale amyas leigh what brings hither how fare brother where be ship brother be well mr gilbert golden hind be gone on to dartmouth with mr hayes came ashore here meaning to go north to bideford ere went to london called at drake just now be away golden hind what brings home so soon yet welcome ever sir said mr hawkins be great surprise though captain john did not look for till next year amyas be silent something be wrong cried adrian speak amyas tried must not will drive man mad sir have adventure failed said brother be well be well then what why do look at in fashion sir springing up adrian rushed forward held candle to amyas face amyas lip quivered a laid hand on adrian shoulder great glorious brother sir be better bestowed than in settling newfoundland dead shrieked adrian be with god whom served be always with like enoch parable parable if love sir like enoch be not for god took adrian clasped hand over forehead leaned against table go on sir go on god will give strength to hear gradually amyas opened to adrian tragic story mr hayes have long ago told far too well to allow second edition of from of unruliness of men ruffian a said before caught up at hap hazard of conspiracy to carry off ship plunder of fishing vessel desertion multiplying daily license from general to lazy fearful to return home till adrian broke out with groan from conspired against deserted from dotard buzzard where must have found such leader illustrious brother sir said amyas if will pardon be very great philosopher not so much of general general sir where be braver man not on god earth doe not make general sir if cortez have be brave more mexico must have be mexico still truth be sir cortez like captain drake knew when to hang man great brother did not amyas a suppose be right gilbert be man who must be angry enough at baseness neglect who be too kindly to punish be one who must form wisest best digested plan who must not stoop to hail fellow well met drudgery among subordinate have be talisman of great captain then amyas went on to tell rest of story setting sail from st john to discover southward coast sir humphrey chivalrous determination to go in little squirrel of only ten ton overcharged with netting fight small ordnance not only because be more fit to examine creek because have heard of taunt against among men that be afraid of sea after woe on woe how seven day after left cape raz largest ship delight after have most part of night quote hayes like swan singeth before death continued in sounding of trumpet drum fife also winding of comet hautboy in end of jollity left off with battle doleful knell struck next day golden hind squirrel sheering off just in time upon unknown shoal where be lost fourteen among frank philosopher friend poor budaeus who escaped after horror of cold famine be cast on shore in newfoundland how worn out with hunger want of clothes crew of two remaining ship persuaded sir humphrey to sail toward england on st of august on very instant even in winding about beheld close alongside very lion in shape hair color not swimming sliding on water with whole body who passed along turning head to fro yawning gaping wide with ugly demonstration of long teeth glaring eye to bid farewell coming right against hind sent forth horrible voice roaring bellowing a doth lion what opinion others have thereof chiefly general forbear to deliver took for bonum omen rejoicing that be to war against enemy if be devil devil be doubtless said adrian roaring lion who go about seeking whom may devour have not got brother at least quoth amyas rejoined mr hawkins smile not reader for be day in men believed in devil roared for joy to think how many poor soul must be left still in heathen darkness by sir humphrey death god be with good knight send mariner where be now then amyas told last scene how when be off azores storm came on heavier than ever with terrible sea breaking short pyramid wise till on th september tiny squirrel nearly foundered yet recovered general sitting abaft with book in hand cried out to in hind so oft a did approach within hearing 'we be a near heaven by sea a by land ' reiterating same speech well beseeming soldier resolute in jesus christ a can testify be same monday about twelve of clock not long after frigate squirrel being ahead of in even in full flight deal terrible backhanded stroke at pursuer help now be sorry to say for honor of country that be by mean safe thing in day to travel from plymouth to north of devon because to get to journey end unless be minded to make circuit of many mile must need pas through territory of foreign hostile potentate who have many time ravaged dominion defeated force of majesty queen elizabeth be named behind back at least king of gubbings so now dare call say fuller secured by distance one of more valor durst not do to face for fear fury fall upon yet hitherto have met with none who must render reason of name call shaving of fish be little worth gubbings sure be that be sensible that word importeth shame disgrace a for suggestion of worthy learned friend mr joseph maynard such a did inhabitare monte gibberosos be called gubbings such will smile at ingenuity who dissent from truth of etymology have read of england beyond wale gubbings land be scythia within england pure heathen therein lieth nigh brent for in edge of dartmoor be reported that two hundred year since two bad woman being with child fled thither to hide to whom certain lewd fellow resorted be first original be peculiar of own making exempt from bishop archdeacon authority ecclesiastical civil live in cot rather hole than house like swine having in common multiplied without marriage into many hundred language be dross of dreg of vulgar devonian more learned man be worse can understand during civil war soldier be quartered upon for fear of being quartered amongst wealth consisteth in other men good live by stealing sheep on moor vain be for to search house being work beneath pain of sheriff above power of constable such be fleetness will outrun many horse vivaciousness outlive most men living in ignorance of luxury extinguisher of life hold together like bee offend one will revenge quarrel now be informed that begin to be civilized tender child to baptism return to be men yea christian again hope civil people amongst will turn barbarian now barbarian begin to be civilized fuller p with quip against anabaptist of day fuller end story leave to set forth how amyas in fear of same scythian heathen rode out of plymouth on right good horse in full suit of armor carrying lance sword over above two great dag horse pistol behind salvation yeo five six north devon men who have served with in ireland be returning on furlough clad in head piece quilted jerkin man with pike sword yeo with arquebuse match while two sumpter pony carried baggage of formidable troop pushed on a fast a must through tavistock to reach before lydford where meant to sleep what with buying horse other delay have not be able to start before noon night fell just a reached frontier of enemy country dreary place enough be by wild glare of sunset high tableland of heath banked on right by crag hill of dartmoor sloping away to south west toward foot of great cone of brent tor towered up like extinct volcano a say that really be crowned with tiny church votive offering of plymouth merchant of old time who vowed in sore distress to build church to blessed virgin on first point of english land must see far away down waste slope must see tiny thread of blue smoke rising from den of gubbings more than once called halt to examine whether distant furze bush pony might not be patrol of advancing army be very well to laugh at now in nineteenth century be laughing matter then a found before have gone two mile farther on middle of down stood wayside inn desolate villainous looking lump of lichen spotted on left lydford ill omened castle century after be one of principal scene of judge jeffreys cruelty amyas party trudged on through mire toward okehampton till sunrise ere vapor have lifted from mountain top be descending long slope from sourton down while yestor amicombe slept steep black beneath misty pall roaring far below unseen ockment leapt from crag cloud down cataract laughing loud voice of stream recalled word to amyas mind nymph of torridge have spoken upon day of triumph recollected too vexation on day at not seeing rose salterne why have never seen since never seen now for six year more of ripened beauty knew only by hearsay be still to lovely fifteen year girl for whose sake have smitten barnstaple draper over quay what chain of petty accident have kept from meeting though so often within mile of other what lucky one said practical old amyas to if have seen a be now might have loved a frank doe poor frank what will say what doe say for must know already what ought to say to do rather for talking be use on side grave on other expect then asked whether old oath meant nothing something whether be mere tavern frolic sacred duty held more that looked at that meant latter what must do have nothing on earth sword so must not travel to find after might not be gone far perhaps not gone at might be mistake exaggerated scandal must hope so yet be evident that there have be passage between don guzman eustace mysterious word about promise at lundy proved that villain have felt all along that be villain just one to win woman heart too frank have be away brotherhood away what fool have be to turn wolf loose into sheepfold yet who must have dreamed of at event said amyas trying to comfort need not complain have lost nothing stood more chance of against frank than must have stood against don so there be use for to cry about matter tried to hum tune concerning general frailty of woman nevertheless like sir hugh felt that have great disposition to cry never have expected to win yet seemed bitter to know that be lost to forever be not so easy for heart of make to toss away image of first love le easy because image be stained ruined curse on man who have done that deed will yet have heart blood somehow if go round world again to find if there be law for on earth there be law in heaven be much mistaken with determination rode into ugly dirty stupid town of okehampton with fallen man by strange perversity have chosen to defile one of loveliest site in pleasant land of devon heartily did amyas abuse old town day for be detained there a expected full three hour while justice willow of place be sent for from farm whither have gone at sunrise after early rising fashion of day to take yeo deposition concerning last night affray moreover when willow came refused to take deposition because ought to have be made before brother willow at lydford in wrangling ensued be very near finding out what amyas fearing fresh loss of time worse evil beside have commanded to be concealed namely presence of jesuit in moorland utopia then in broadest devon do call christian conduct sir to set quiet man like upon gubbings a if be going to risk precious life ever constable to okehampton let lydfor men mind lydfor roogs by lydfor law if will hang first try after a for have rade bible that meddleth with strife be like taketh dog by ear so if choose to sit down ate breakfast with well good deposition will have none if man be enquired for will be answerable for appearing in course expect mortally with wink wai hear much more of matter from have have hundred fifty loose fellow in first fortnight knew better still smarting from effect of similar haste in newfoundland adventure have determined to take none picked men by dint of labor obtained only one scapegrace did take into crew named parracombe by scapegrace hang tale be old schoolfellow of at bideford son of merchant in town one of unlucky member who be nobody enemy own handsome idle clever fellow who used scholarship of have picked up smattering chiefly to justify own escapade to string song together having drunk that be worth at home have in penitent fit forsworn liquor tormented amyas into taking to sea where afterwards made a good sailor a one else sorely scandalized john brimblecombe by manner of heretical argument half anacreontic half smacking of rather loose doctrine of family of love tormented orthodoxy morality of more than one bishop of exeter poor will parracombe be born few century too early have lived now might have published volume two of poetry then settled down on staff of newspaper have even lived thirty year later than did might have written frantic tragedy filthy comedy for edification of james profligate metropolis roistered in jesuit to assassinate queen a parry somerville many other madman did so at least jesuit other seems to have thought shortly after amyas have agreed to give spendthrift berth on board for one day amyas question about projected voyage of rose good many of will confessed have answered before saw fellow drift after egyptian have offered vast sum of money to do desperate villainy whether be to murder amyas queen whether to bore hole in bottom of good ship rose to set torridge on fire by art magic be too drunk to recollect exactly whereon amyas treated three quarter of story a tipsy dream contented by getting warrant against landlady for harboring egyptian be then heavy offence gipsy disguise being favorite one with jesuit emissary of course denied that gipsy have be there though there be who thought have seen man come in none have seen go out again on amyas took occasion to ask what have become of suspicious popish ostler whom have seen at mariner rest three year before discovered to gained by plain honesty patience common sense power over human heart power over work whatsoever might be frank must only admire afar off men looked up to a infallible prided on forestalling wish fit place for mother kiss went to rocky knoll outside churchyard wall watched ship glide out between yellow denes lessen slowly hour by hour into boundless west till hull sank below dim horizon white sail faded away into gray atlantic mist perhaps forever mr leigh gathered cloak about bowed head worshipped then went home to loneliness prayer chapter xvii how came to barbados found men therein sun not stir from hammock pacing up down gaining strength with step well done lad cried amyas keep cheerful mind will have music ashore after dinner for want of mermaid to sing to can dance may so four art thou then to praise so for running falstaff o horseback ye cuckoo foot will not budge foot p henry yes jack upon instinct falstaff grant ye upon instinct henry iv pt have slipped past southern point of grenada in night be at last within fairy ring of island on nature have concentrated beauty man sin if barbados have be invested in eye of newcomer with strange glory how much more sea on now entered smile in almost perpetual calm untouched by hurricane roar past far to northward sky sea island be one vast rainbow though little marked perhaps by sturdy practical sailor whose main thought be of spanish gold pearl a little by amyas who accustomed to scenery of tropic be speculating inwardly on possibility of extirpating spaniard annexing west indie to domain of queen elizabeth yet even unpoetic eye must not behold without awe excitement land so famous yet so new around wonder pity greed of age have concentrated be awful thought yet inspiriting that be entering region unknown to englishman where penalty of failure must be worse than death torment of inquisition not more than five time before perhaps have mysterious sea be visited by english keel there be on board who knew well too well who first of british mariner have attempted under captain john hawkins to trade along very coast interdicted from necessary of life by spanish jealousy have in true english fashion won market at sword point then bought sold honestly peaceably therein old mariner of pelican minion be questioned day long for name of isle cape fish bird while frank stood by listening serious silent great awe seemed to have possessed soul yet not sad one for face seemed daily to drink in glory from glory round murmuring to at while be gate of heaven stood watching day long careless of food rest a forward plunge of ship displayed fresh wonder island cape hung high in air with inverted image below long sand hill rolled weltered in mirage yellow flower bed huge thorny cactus like giant candelabra clothed glaring slope twisted tossed flickered till whole scene seemed one blazing phantom world in everything be a unstable a be fantastic even to sun distorted into strange oval pear shaped figure by bed of crimson mist through sank to rest while frank wondered yeo rejoiced for to southward of setting sun cluster of tall peak rose from sea unless reckoning be wrong be mountain of macanao at western end of margarita isle of pearl then famous in city of mediterranean at great german fair second only in richness to pearl island in gulf of panama fifteen year before have cost john oxenham life next day saw running along north side of island having passed undiscovered a far a must see castle spaniard have built at eastern end for protection of pearl fishery at last opened deep still bight wooded to water edge lying in roadstead caravel three boat by at sight there be not man be on deck at once not mouth be giving opinion of what must be done be for sailing right into roadstead breeze blowing fresh toward shore a usually doe throughout island in afternoon however seeing billow break here there off bay mouth thought better for fear of rock to run by quietly then send in pinnace boat yeo must have have show spanish color for fear of alarming caravel amyas stoutly refused counting said mean thing to tell lie in way unless in extreme danger for great end of state so holding on course till be shut out by next point started cary in largest boat with twenty men amyas in smaller one with fifteen more among whom be john brimblecombe who must need come in cassock band with old sword of uncle prized mightily when came to bight mouth found a have expected coral rock too many of so that have to run along edge of reef long way before must find passage for boat while be so doing of who be new to indie be admiring through clear element living flower bed subaqueous garden of nereus amphitrite there suddenly appeared below what yeo called school of shark of nearly a long a boat who looked up at wistfully enough out of wicked scowling eye jack said amyas who sat next to look how big fellow eye thee have surely taken fancy to plump hide of thine think thou wouldst eat a tender a sucking porker jack turned very pale said nothing now a befell just then very big fellow seeing parrot fish come out of cleft of coral made at from below a did two three more poor fish finding other escape leaped clean into air almost aboard boat while just where have come out of water three four great brown shagreened nose clashed together within two yard of jack a sat showing horrible row of saw teeth then sank sulkily down again to watch for fresh bait at jack said very softly in manus tuas domine turning eye in board have lust to look at shark more so having got through reef in ran with fair breeze caravel not being now musket shot off cary laid aboard before spaniard have time to get to ordnance standing up in stern sheet shouted to to yield captain asked boldly enough in whose name in name of common sense ye dog cry will do not see that be fifty strong to twenty whereon up side scrambled captain fired pistol at cary knocked over unwilling to shed needle blood on crew yielded falling on knee leaping overboard prize be taken in meanwhile amyas have pulled round under stern boarded boat be second from for nearest be fast alongside so sure prize spaniard in yielded without blow cry misericordia negro leaping overboard swam ashore like sea dog meanwhile third boat be not oar length off turned to pull away whereby befell notable adventure for john brimblecombe casting about in valiant mind how must distinguish day must need catch up boat hook claw on to stern shouting stay ye papist stay spanish dog by a be to be expected being ten to one be forthwith pulled overboard fell along on nose in sea leaving hook fast in stern where know not how being seized with panic fear lively imagination filling sea with shark have just seen fell roaring like town bull in confusion never thought to turn get aboard again struck out lustily after spanish boat whether in hope of catching hold of boat hook trailed behind from very madness of valor man must divine on swam cassock afloat behind looking for world like great black monk fish howling puffing with mouth full of salt water stay ye spanish dog help good fellow see not that be dead man be nuzzling already at toe hath hold of leg right thigh be bitten clean off oh be preaching in hartland pulpit stay spanish dog yield papist coward least make mincemeat of take aboard yield say blood be on head be jonah if swallow will never cast up again be better to fall into hand of man than into hand of devil with three row of teeth apiece in manus tuas orate pro anima so forth in more frantic case than ever be panurge in ever memorable seasickness till english expecting minute to be snapped up by shark brained by spaniard oar let fly volley into fugitive on leaped overboard like fellow whereon jack scrambled into boat drawing sword with one hand while wiped water out of eye with other began to lay about like very lion cutting empty air cry yield idolater yield spanish dog however coming to after while seeing that there be one on whom to flesh maiden steel sits down panting in sternsheets begin stripping off hose on amyas thinking surely that good fellow have gone mad with stroke of sun by having fallen into sea after being overheated with rowing bade pull alongside asked in heaven name what be doing with nether tackle on jack amid such laughter a may be conceived vowed swore that right thigh be bitten clean through to bone yea that felt hose full of blood so must have swooned away for imaginary loss of blood so strong be delusion on have not friend after much arguing on part anger on persuaded that be whole sound after set to work to overhaul maiden prize found full of hide salt pork yet not of alone for in captain cabin also in sternsheets of boat brimblecombe have so valorously boarded be certain frail of leaf packed neatly enough being opened be full of goodly pearl though somewhat brown for spaniard used to damage color in haste greediness opening shell by fire instead of leaving to decay gradually after arabian fashion with prize though must not guess value very exactly went off content enough after malicious fellow have set ship on fire being laden with hide be nosegay a burnt amyas be very angry at wanton damage in model drake have never indulged cary have jest ready ah said 'lutheran devil be know so be bound to vanish like other fiend with evil savor a soon however a amyas be on board again rounded friend mr brimblecombe in ear told have better play man little more roaring le before be hurt keeping breath to help stroke if wished crew to listen much to discourse frank hearing bade amyas leave offender to so began upon with come hither thou recreant jack thou lily livered jack thou hysterical jack tell now thou hast read plato dialogue aristotle logic to jack very meekly answered yes then will deal with thee after manner of ancient sage ask whether greater must not contain le jack yes sure frank be more than part contain that part more than be jack yes sure frank then tell be not priest more than layman jack who be always very loud about dignity of priesthood a many of cloth be who have other dignity whereon to stand answered very boldly of course frank then priest containeth man be man something over viz priesthood jack who saw whither must lead suppose so frank then if priest show man show more priest will tell what master frank say jack may be right by logic shark be logic understand frank nay recalcitrant jack stiff necked jack be part of man to howl like pig in gate because think be there be not there jack have not word to say frank still more when if have be there have be duty of brave man to have kept mouth shut if only to keep salt water out not add evil of choking to of being eaten ah say jack be very fine know a well a that be not spaniard be afraid of be heaven handiwork knew how to deal with a for fiend spawn of shark when saw that fellow take fish alongside upset clean there be end of frank oh jack jack behold how one sin begets just now thou wert coward now thou art manichee for thou hast imputed to evil creator that be formed only for good end namely shark be made on purpose to devour useless carcass like thine moreover a brother of rose thou wert bound by vow of thy brotherhood to have leaped joyfully down shark mouth jack ay very likely if mistress rose have be in stomach wanted to fight spaniard just then not to be shark bitten frank jack thy answer savor of self will if be ordained that thou shouldst advance end of brotherhood by being shark bitten flea bitten bitten by sharper to detriment of thy carnal wealth shortly to suffer shame torment whatsoever even to strappado scarpines thou art bound to obey thy destiny not after vain roman conceit to choose manner of thine own death be indeed only sort of self murder therefore consider thee a cause of scandal rotten creaking branch to be excised by spiritual arm do hereby excise thee cut thee off jack nay faith be little too much master frank how long have be bishop of exeter frank jack thy wit being blinded full of gross vapor by reason of perturbation of fear like anger be short madness raise in phantasy vain spectre videlicet of shark spaniard mistake lucidity for thy manicheeism let lordship of exeter deal with for thy abominable howling caterwauling offensive in chained cur scandalous in preacher brother of rose do hereby deprive thee of thine office of chaplain to brotherhood warn thee that unless within seven day thou do deed equal to seven champion ruggiero orlando self thou shalt be deprived of sword dagger allowed henceforth to carry more iron about thee than will serve to mend thy pen now jack said amyas will give thee piece of news wonder that young men a parson complain so loudly will not listen to gospel while be preached to by men on whom can not look down set of softhanded fellow who can not dig be ashamed to beg a brother have must need be parson before be men frank ay even though may excuse that in popish priest friar who be vowed not to be men get bread shamefully rascally by telling sinner who owe hundred measure to sit down quickly take bill write fifty yet for priest of church of england whose business be not merely to smuggle sinful soul up backstairs into heaven to make men good christian by making good men good gentleman good englishman to show white feather in hour of need be to unpreach in one minute that have be preaching life long tell thee say amyas if have not taken thee for guess sort of man have never let thee have care of hundred brave lad immortal soul so on of boarding at once with heavy shot larboard starboard till fairly clapped hand to ear ran for leaving poor frank laughing so heartily that amyas be after glad thing have happened for sake of smile put into sad steadfast countenance next day be sunday on after divine service must hardly persuade jack to read so shamefaced be a for preaching after must not hear of such thing amyas read aloud according to custom article of agreement then seeing abreast of sloping beach with shoot of clear water running into sea agreed that must land there wash clothes again water ship for have found water somewhat scarce at barbados on party jack brimblecombe must need go taking with sword great arquebuse for have dreamed last night said that be set upon by spaniard be sure that dream must come true moreover that did not very much care if did if ever got back alive for be better to die than be made ape scarecrow laughed at by men badgered with ramus logic plato dialectical devilry to confess manichee for aught knew turbaned turk hebrew jew so flung into boat like man desperate so went ashore after amyas have given strict command against letting off firearm for fear of alarming spaniard there washed clothes stretched leg with great joy admiring beauty of place then began to shoot seine have brought on shore with in say chronicler caught many strange fish beside sea cow full seven foot long with limpet barnacle on back a if have be stick of drift timber be fond foolish beast yet pious withal for finding corpse watch over day night until decay be buried indian call manati who carry young under arm give suck like woman being wounded lamenteth aloud with human voice be said at certain season to sing very melodiously melody perhaps having be heard in sea be that mr frank reported to be choir of siren triton avouch for truth rashly deny having seen such fertility of nature wonder hold who denieth aught merely for strangeness to be ribald ignoramus also one of men brought in two great black fowl have shot with crossbow bodied headed like capon bigger than eagle spaniard call curassos with sea cow afterwards made good cheer roast sodden for cow be very dainty meat a good a four month calf tender fat withal after set to work filling cask barricos having laid boat up to outflow of rivulet lucky for be a fell out that be close together at work not abroad skylarking a have be hour before now john brimblecombe have gone apart a soon a landed with shamefaced doleful countenance sitting down under great tree plucked bible from bosom read steadfastly girded with great sword arquebuse lying by too be well for for rest for have not yet finished watering when there be cry that enemy be on out of wood not twenty yard from good parson came full fifty shot with multitude of negro behind officer in front on horseback with great plume of feather in hat sword drawn in hand stand for life shouted amyas only just in time for worthy man from first day of school fellowship till be laid in parish church of hartland where now sleep in peace touch of sin of covetousness have in age in ours le than others beset especially know not why who minister about sanctuary man though be ugly lowly in person in understanding simple of breeding poor parson son have yet in spirit so loving cheerful so lifted from base selfish purpose to worship of duty to generosity rather knightly than sacerdotal that through life seemed to think only that be more blessed to give than to receive wealth gained in war dispersed among sister poor of parish living unmarried till death like true lover constant mourner a will be said in place leaving hardly wherewith to bring body to grave at whom if often laughed once must now rather envy desiring to be here what be that may be hereafter where be amen chapter xix what befell at la guayra great be cry running riding at season be made in place beacon be fired a need then required to save great treasure have little space winning of cales men must gladly have hawked awhile round margarita cubagua for pearl prize amyas having a phrased fleshed dog be loth to hang about island after alarm have be given ran therefore south west across mouth of great bay stretch from peninsula of paria to cape codera leaving on right hand tortuga on left meadow island of piritoos two long green line few inch above tideless sea yeo drew knew foot of way have good reason to know for first of english mariner have tried to trade along coast with hawkins now right ahead sheer out of sea from base to peak arose higher higher mighty range of caracas mountain beside hill most of crew have ever seen seemed petty mound frank of course knew alp amyas andes cary notion of height be bounded by m'gillicuddy reek brimblecombe by exmoor latter to cary infinite amusement spent whole day holding on by rigging staring upwards with chin higher than nose till got stiff neck soon sea became rough chopping though breeze be fair gentle ere be abreast of cape became aware of strong eastward current during winter month so often baffle mariner who wish to go to westward night long struggled through billow with huge wall of cape codera thousand foot above head to left beyond again bank upon bank of mountain bathed in yellow moonlight morning showed large ship have passed during night upon opposite course be now good ten mile to eastward yeo be for going back taking of latter made matter of course former be easy enough for breeze blowing dead off land be soldier wind there back again for ship amyas frank height from in town above remained motionless men fretted fumed for weary hour at thus seeing rich prize for of course town be paved with gold within arm reach yet impossible let amyas men have patience short five year more great armada will have come gone then that avenging storm of like oxenham hawkins drake be avant courier will burst upon spanish port from corunna to cadiz from canary to havana la guayra st yago de leon will not escape share captain amyas preston captain sommers colonist of bermuda sommers island will land with force tiny enough though larger far than leigh where capital amid ring of mountain wall impregnable to englishman zouaves for up seven thousand foot of precipice rise stair on stair behind town fierce adventurer will climb hand over hand through rain fog while men lie down beg officer to kill for farther can go yet farther will go hewing path with sword through wood of wild plantain rhododendron thicket over so seems however incredible very saddle of silla down upon astonished mantuanos of st jago driving before having burnt city in default of ransom will return triumphant by right road pas along coast master of deep humboldt say that there be none have imagined twenty different one in last hour be equally uncertain impossible have ceased to struggle go where be called love willing victim if heaven accept sacrifice will provide altar knife nothing frivolity heartlessness godlessness becomes laughing stock dy one of saddest book say again man can read amyas hardly dare trust to speak for fear of saying too much must not help saying be metal third without first must have be useless in heart of english men english ship be much shorter than spanish with rig of day gave ease in manoeuvring utterly confounded spanish foe english ship in fight of say camden charged enemy with marvellous agility having discharged broadside flew forth presently into deep levelled shot directly without missing at great ship of spaniard be altogether heavy unwieldy moreover spanish fashion in west indie at least though not in ship of great armada be for sake of carrying merchandise to build men of war flush decked a be called race razes left on deck exposed open while english fashion be to heighten ship a much a possible at stem stern by sweep of line also by stockade close fight cage work on poop forecastle thus giving to men shelter be further increased by strong bulkhead cobridgeheads across main deck below dividing ship thus into number of separate fort fitted with swivel base fowler murderer loopholed for musketry arrow great source of superiority be after in men english sailor be then a now quite amphibious cunning animal capable of turning hand to everything from needlework carpentry to gunnery hand to hand blow be moreover one of nation citizen of be not merely permitted to carry arm compelled by law to practise from childhood use of bow accustomed to consider sword play quarter staff a necessary part parcel of education pastime of leisure hour fiercest nation upon earth a be then called freest also man of fought for with self help self respect of yankee ranger once bidden to do work be trusted to carry out by own wit a best must in one word be free man english officer too a now lived on term of sympathy with men unknown to spaniard who raised between commander commanded absurd barrier of rank blood forbade to pride labor that of fighting english officer on other hand brought up to same athletic sport same martial exercise a men be not ashamed to care for to win friendship even on emergency to consult judgment used rank not to differ from men to outvie not merely to command be obeyed like homer hero old norse viking to lead be followed drake touched true mainspring of english success when once in voyage round world indignantly rebuked coxcomb gentleman adventurer with must like to see gentleman will refuse to set hand to rope must have gentleman to hale draw with mariner be day in majesty service be a little overridden by absurd rule of seniority a by etiquette be at once counterfeit ruin of true discipline under elizabeth minister brave shrewd man be certain of promotion let rank age be what might true honor of knighthood covered once for lowliness of birth merchant service in best sea captain even of noble blood be more le engaged be then nursery not only for seaman for warrior in day when spanish portuguese trader whenever have chance got rid of english competition by salvo of cannon shot hence a have said that strong fellow feeling between officer men hence mutiny a sir richard hawkins tell be unknown in english ship while in spanish broke out on slight occasion for spaniard by suicidal pedantry have allowed navy to be crippled by same despotism etiquette official routine by whole nation be gradually frozen to death in course of next century two forgetting fifty year before cortez pizarro early conquistador of america have achieved miraculous triumph on exactly opposite method by very fellow feeling between commander commanded by english be now conquering in turn navy be organized on plan complete enough on one be a event proved utterly fatal to prowess unanimity made even courage honor useless against assault of free men do in armada at sea divide into three body to wit soldier mariner gunner soldier officer watch ward a if on shore be only condition of parting among with new comer to tell sad strange story how after captain hawkins constrained by famine have put ashore wandered in misery till spaniard took how instead of hanging a at first intended don fed clothed allotted a servant to various gentleman about mexico where throve turned hand like true sailor to manner of trade made much money of be married even to woman of wealth so that went well until fatal year when much against mind of many of spaniard that cruel bloody inquisition be established for first time in indie how from moment life be one long tragedy how be imprisoned for year half not for proselytizing simply for not believing in transubstantiation racked again again at last adjudged to receive publicly on good friday three hundred one hundred stripe to serve in galley for six ten year while a crowning atrocity of moloch sacrifice three of be burnt alive in market place of mexico story no le hideous than true detail whereof whoso list may read in hakluyt third volume a told by philip mile one of hapless crew a well a adventure of job hortop messmate of who after being sent to spain seeing two more of companion burnt alive at seville be sentenced to row in galley ten year after to go to everlasting prison remediless from doom after twenty three year of slavery be delivered by galleon dudley came safely home to redriff fate of hortop comrade be of course still unknown to rescued men history even of party be not likely to improve good feeling of crew toward spanish ship be two mile to leeward of must be fought with fled from before quarter of hour be past so kneeling down upon deck a many brave crew in day did in like case gave god thanks devoutly for favor have found then with one accord at jack leading sang one ninety fourth psalm oh lord thou dost revenge wrong vengeance belongs to thee etc crew of tobie cast away on barbary coast few year after began with heavy heart to sing twelfth psalm lord for good godly men etc howbeit ere have finished four verse wave of sea have stopped breath of most then again to quarter for day work more than half still remained to be done hardly be deck cleared afresh damage repaired a best must be when came ranging up to leeward a closehauled a must be a said long flush decked ship of full five hundred ton more than double size in fact of rose though not so lofty in proportion many bold heart beat loud shame to a began firing away merrily determined a well knew to wipe out in english blood disgrace of late foil never mind merry master said amyas have quantity quality be true said one for one honest man be worth two rogue one culverin three of footy little ordnance said so when will captain have at let come abreast of burn powder have wind can do what like with serve men out horn of ale round steward take time so waited for five minute more then set to work quietly after fashion of english mastiff though like mastiff waxed right mad before three round be fired white splinter sight beloved began to crackle fly amyas having a have said wind being able to go nearer than spaniard kept place at easy point blank range for two eighteen pounder culverin yeo mate worked with terrible effect be lacking through through shot said leave small ordnance alone yet awhile will sink without whing whing went spaniard shot like so many humming top through rigging far above head for ill constructed port of day prevented gun from hulling enemy who be to windward unless close alongside blow jolly breeze cried one lay don over thou canst what murrain be gone aloft there ala crack flap rattle blank dismay unlucky shot have cut foremast already wounded in two forward be mass of dangling wreck forward cut away wreck said amyas unmoved small arm men be ready will be aboard of in five minute be too true rose unmanageable from loss of head sail lay at mercy of spaniard archer musqueteers have hardly time to range to leeward when madre dolorosa chain be grinding against rose grapple tossed on board from stem to stern cut loose roared amyas let stay see fun now dog of devon show teeth hurrah for god queen then began fight most fierce fell spaniard according to fashion attempting to board english amid fierce shout of god queen god st george for england sweeping back by shower of arrow musquet ball thrusting down with pike hurling grenade stink pot from top while swivel on side poured grape bar chain great main deck gun thundering muzzle to muzzle made ship quiver recoil a smashed round shot through through other so roared flashed fast clenched to other in devil wedlock under cloud of smoke beneath cloudless tropic sky while around dolphin gambolled flying fish shot on from swell to swell rainbow hued jelly opened shut cup of living crystal to sun a merrily a if man have never fallen hell have never broken loose on earth so raged for hour more till arm be weary tongue clove to mouth sick men rotting with scurvy scrambled up on deck fought with strength of madness tiny powder boy handing up cartridge from hold laughed cheered a shot ran past ear old salvation yeo text upon lip fury in heart a of joshua elijah in old time worked on calm grim with energy of boy at play now then opening in smoke showed spanish captain in suit of black steel armor standing cool proud guiding pointing careless of iron hail too lofty gentleman to soil glove with aught knightly sword hilt while amyas will after fashion of english gentleman have stripped nearly a bare a own sailor be cheering thrusting hewing hauling here there everywhere like common mariner filling with spirit of self respect fellow feeling personal daring discipline of spaniard more perfect mechanically cold tyrannous crushing spiritually never must bestow black plumed senor be obeyed golden locked amyas be followed must have be followed through jaw of hell spaniard ere five minute have passed poured en masse into rose waist only to destruction between poop forecastle a be then fashion upper deck beam be left open unplanked with exception of narrow gangway on side off fatal ledge boarder thrust on by behind fell headlong between beam to main deck below to be slaughtered helpless in pit of destruction by double fire from bulkhead fore aft while few who kept footing on gangway after vain attempt to force stockade on poop forecastle leaped overboard again amid shower of shot arrow fire of english be a steady a be quick though three fourth of crew have never smelt powder before proved well truth of old chronicler saying since proved again more gloriously than ever at alma balaklava inkerman that english never fight better than in first battle thrice spaniard clambered on board thrice surged back before deadly hail deck on side be very shamble jack brimblecombe who have fought a long a conscience must allow found when turned to more clerical occupation enough to do in carrying poor wretch to surgeon without giving spiritual consolation longed to give to receive at last there be lull in wild storm shot be heard from spaniard upper deck amyas leaped into mizzen rigging looked through smoke dead men must descry through blinding veil rolled in heap laid flat dead men dying man upon foot last volley have swept deck clear one by one have dropped below to escape fiery shower alone at helm grinding teeth with rage mustachio curling up to very eye stood spanish captain now be moment for counter stroke amyas shouted for boarder in two minute more be over side clutching at spaniard mizzen rigging what be distance between enemy side be widening be sheering off yes rising too growing bodily higher moment a if by magic amyas looked up in astonishment saw what be spaniard be heeling fast over to leeward away from mast be sloping forward swifter swifter end be come then back in god name back men be sinking by head with much ado be dragged back leaped back old michael heard with hair beard floating in wind bronzed naked figure like weird old indian fakir still climbed on steadfastly up mizzen chain of spaniard hatchet in hand come back michael leap while may shouted dozen voice michael turned what must come back for then to go home where one knoweth will die like englishman day will know rason why turning sprang in over bulwark a huge ship rolled up more more like dying whale exposing long black hulk almost down to keel one of lower deck gun a if in defiance exploded upright into air hurling ball to very heaven in instant be answered from rose by column of smoke eighteen pound ball crashed through bottom of defenceless spaniard who fired shame to fire on sinking ship gunner yeo sir shouted voice up from main deck be like madman down here tell if fire again will put in iron if be own brother cut away grapple aloft men see how drag over cut away will sink with cut away rose released from strain shook feather on wave crest like freed sea gull while men held breath suddenly glorious creature righted rose again a if in noble shame for one last struggle with doom bow be deep in water after deck still dry righted only for moment long enough to let crew come pouring wildly up on deck with cry prayer rush aft to poop where under flag of spain stood tall captain left hand on standard staff sword pointed in right back men heard cry die like valiant mariner of ran to bulwark shouted mercy surrender english broke into cheer called to to run alongside silence shouted amyas take surrender from mutineer senor cried to captain springing into rigging taking off hat for love of god men strike surrender buena querra spaniard lifted hat bowed courteously answered impossible senor querra be good stain honor god have mercy on then amen said spaniard crossing gave one awful lounge forward dived under coming swell hurling crew into eddy nothing point of poop remained there stood stern steadfast don cap pie in glistening black armor immovable a man of iron while over flag claimed empire of world flaunted gold aloft upwards in glare of tropic noon will not carry that flag to devil with will have yet if die for said will cary rushed to side to leap overboard amyas stopped let die a have lived with honor wild figure sprang out of mass of sailor who struggled shrieked amid foam rushed upward at spaniard be michael heard don who stood above plunged sword into old man body hatchet gleamed nevertheless down went blade through headpiece through head a heard sprang onward bleeding alive steel clad corpse rattled down deck into surge two more stroke struck with fury of dying man standard staff be hewn through old michael collected strength hurled flag far from sinking ship then stood erect one moment shouted god save queen be english answered with hurrah rent welkin moment gulf have swallowed victim poop nothing remained of madre dolorosa few floating spar struggling wretch while great awe fell upon men solemn silence broken only by cry of strong swimmer in agony then suddenly collecting a men awakened from dream half dozen desperate gallant reckless of shark eddy leaped overboard swam towards flag towed alongside in triumph ah said salvation yeo a helped trophy up over side ah be not for nothing that found poor michael be always good comrade nigh a good one a william penberthy of marazion whom lord grant meet in bliss now then master will inshore again burn la guayra art thou never gained level spot full thousand foot above sea backed by inaccessible cliff formed upper shoulder of mighty mountain defended below by steep wooded slope needing felling of few tree to make impregnable amyas settled sick under arched root of enormous cottonwood tree made second journey to ship to bring up hammock blanket for while yeo wisdom courage be of inestimable value a pioneer have found little brook up forced way have encouraged to climb cliff over fell arguing rightly that on course be sure to find ground fit for encampment within reach of water have supported amyas when again need to play cortez who be not such bad fellow after will because will have such cannibal fiend tyranny to rid earth of a have trust will fear god enough not to play pizarro so conversation dropped for time none of forgot in mountain nook party spent ten day more several of sick men died from fever superadded to wound probably from having be bled by surgeon others mended steadily by help of certain herb yeo administered much to disgust of doctor who of course wanted to bleed poor fellow round be mutinous when amyas stayed hand in meanwhile by dint of daily trip to ship provision be plentiful enough beside raccoon monkey other small animal yeo veteran of hawkins crew knew how to catch fruit vegetable above delicious mountain cabbage of areca palm fresh milk of cow tree brought in daily paying well thereby for hospitality received day long careful watch be kept among branch of mighty ceiba tree what tree be hugest english oak must have seemed stunted bush beside borne up on root rather wall of twisted board twelve foot high between whole crew ammunition provision be housed roomily rose enormous trunk full forty foot in girth towering like tall lighthouse smooth for hundred foot then crowned with bough of be stately tree whose topmost twig be full two hundred fifty foot from ground yet be easy for sailor to ascend so many natural rope have kind nature lowered for use in smooth lianes hung to very earth often without knot leaf once in tree be within new world suspended between heaven earth a cary said wonder if like jack when climbed magic bean stalk have found castle giant few acre of well stocked park packed away somewhere amid labyrinth of timber flower garden at least be there in plenty for limb be covered with pendent cactus gorgeous orchis wild pine while one tree be clothed in rich foliage other half utterly leafless bore on twig brilliant yellow flower around humming bird whirred day long parrot peeped in out of cranny while within airy woodland brilliant lizard basked like living gem upon bark gaudy finch flitted chirruped butterfly of size color hovered over topmost twig innumerable insect hummed from morn till eve when sun went down tree toad came out to snore croak till dawn there be more life round that one tree than in whole square mile of english soil amyas a lounged among branch felt at moment a if must be content to stay there forever feed eye ear with wonder then started sighing from dream a recollected that few day must bring foe upon force to decide upon scheme at bravest heart might falter without shame so there sat for often took scout place looking out over fantastic tropic forest at foot flat mangrove swamp below white sheet of foam flecked blue yet sail appeared men a fear of fever subsided began to ask when must go down refit ship amyas put off a best must till one noon saw slipping along shore from westward large ship under easy sail recognized in thought did so ship have passed upon way if be must have run past to la guayra in night have now returned perhaps to search for along coast crept along slowly be in hope that might pas river mouth lay to close to shore after while amyas saw two boat pull in from vanish behind mangrove sliding down liane told what have seen men tired of inactivity received news with shout of joy set to work to make ready for guest four brass swivel have brought up be mounted fixed in log so a to command path musketeer archer clustered round with tackle ready dozen good marksman volunteered into cotton tree with arquebus a post whence man might have very pretty shooting prayer followed a matter of course dinner a matter of course also two weary hour passed before there be sign of spaniard presently wreath of white smoke curled up from swamp then report of caliver then amid growl of english spanish flag ran up above tree floated horrible to behold at mast head of rose be signalling ship for more hand in effect third boat soon pushed off vanished into forest hour during men have thoroughly lost temper not heart by waiting talked so loud strode up down so wildly that amyas have to warn that there be need to betray that spaniard might not find after that might pas stockade close without seeing that unless hit off track at once must probably return to ship for present exacted promise from that must be perfectly silent till gave word to fire wise command have scarcely passed lip when in path below glanced headpiece of spanish soldier then fool whispered amyas to cary be coming up in single file rushing on own death lie close men path be so narrow that two must seldom come up abreast so steep that enemy have much ado to struggle stumble upwards men seemed half unwilling to proceed hung back more than once amyas must hear authoritative voice behind presently there emerged to front sword in hand figure at amyas cary started be surely know leg among thousand though be in armor be turn for now cary remember silence silence men spaniard seemed to feel that be leading forlorn hope don guzman for there be little doubt that be have much ado to get on at fellow have heard how gently handled guayra squadron whisper cary have wish to become fellow martyr with captain of madre dolorosa at last spaniard get up steep slope to within forty yard of stockade pause suspecting trap puzzled by complete silence amyas leap on top of white flag in hand heart beat so fiercely at sight of hated figure that can hardly get out word don guzman quarrel be between not between men mine must have sent in challenge to at la guayra be away challenge now to single combat lutheran dog have halter for sword a served at smerwick will serve now pirate ravisher yours will share be fate a have copied crime learn what be to set foot unbidden on dominion of king of spain devil take king of spain together shout amyas laughing loudly ground belongs to no more than doe to to queen elizabeth in whose name have taken a lawful possession of a ever did of caracas fire men god defend right party obeyed order amyas dropped down behind stockade in time to let caliver bullet whistle over head spaniard recoiled a narrow face of stockade burst into one blaze of musketry swivel raking long array from front to rear front rank fell over other in heap rear one turned ran overtaken nevertheless by english bullet arrow tumbled headlong down steep path out men charge see don be running like rest scrambling over abattis amyas about thirty followed fast for have hope of learning from prisoner brother fate amyas be unjust in last word don guzman a if by miracle have be only slightly wounded seeing men run have rushed back tried to rally be borne away by fugitive however spaniard be out of sight among thick bush before english must overtake amyas afraid lest must rally surround small party withdrew sorely against will found in pathway fourteen spaniard dead for one of wounded with more courage than wisdom have fired in god really believe power enough to be ready a be a one ought to be on god made earth for anything everything being possible then when wonder be discovered go into ecstasy shriek over take to ourselves credit for being susceptible of so lofty feeling true index forsooth of refined cultivated mind paddled onward hour after hour sheltering a best must under shadow of southern bank while on right hand full sun glare lay upon enormous wall of mimosa fig laurel formed northern forest broken by slender shaft of bamboo tuft decked with thousand gaudy parasite bank upon bank of gorgeous bloom piled upward to sky till where outline cut blue flower leaf too lofty to be distinguished by eye formed broken rainbow of hue quivering in ascending stream of azure mist until seemed to melt mingle with very heaven a sun rose higher higher great stillness fell upon forest jaguar monkey have hidden in darkest depth of wood bird note died out one by one very butterfly ceased flitting over tree top slept with outspread wing upon glossy leaf undistinguishable from flower around now then colibri whirred downward toward water hummed for moment around pendent flower then living gem be lost in deep blackness of inner wood among tree trunk a huge dark a pillar of hindoo shrine parrot swung screamed at from overhanging bough thirsty monkey slid lazily down liana to surface of stream dipped up
