of spray whirred up rainbow hung upon for moment black snout sank lazily again here there too upon willow pebbly shore scarlet flamingo stood dreaming knee deep on one leg crested crane pranced up down admiring own finery ibis egret dipped bill under water in search of prey before noon even have slipped away there reigned stillness might be heard stillness to compare small thing with great a brood beneath rich shadow of amyas own devon wood among lonely sweep of exmoor when heather be in flower stillness in a humboldt say if beyond silence listen for faintest undertone detect stifled continuous hum of insect crowd air close to earth confused swarming murmur hang round bush in cracked bark of tree in soil undermined by lizard millepede bee voice proclaiming to that nature breathes that under thousand different form life swarm in gaping dusty earth a much a in bosom of water air breathes around at last soft distant murmur increasing gradually to heavy roar announced that be nearing cataract till turning point where deep alluvial soil rose into low cliff fringed with delicate fern came full in sight of scene at paused not with astonishment with something very like disgust rapid again grumbled one thought have have enough of on orinoco will have to get out draw canoe overland suppose three hour will be lost in very hottest of day too there be worse behind see spray behind palm stop grumbling master cry out before be hurt paddle right up to largest of island let look about in front of be snow white bar of raging foam ten foot high along be ranged three four of fall be so densely fringed with low hedge of shrub that landing seemed impossible indian guide suddenly looking round whispering bade beware of savage pointed to canoe lay swinging in eddy under largest island moored apparently to root of tree silence cried amyas paddle up thither seize canoe if there be indian on island will have speech of mind treat friendly on life strike shoot even if offer to fight so choosing line of smooth backwater just in wake of island drove canoe up by main force fastened safely by side of indian while amyas always foremost sprang boldly on shore whispering to indian boy to follow once on island amyas felt sure enough that if wild tenant have not seen approach certainly have not heard so deafening be noise filled brain seemed to make very leaf upon bush quiver solid stone beneath foot to reel ring for two hundred yard more above fall nothing met eye one white waste of raging foam with here there transverse dyke of rock hurled column of spray surge of beaded water high into air strangely contrasting with still silent cliff of green leaf walled river right left more strangely still with knot of enormous palm upon islet reared polished shaft hundred foot into air straight upright a mast while broad plume golden clustered fruit slept in sunshine far aloft image of stateliest repose amid wildest wrath of nature looked round anxiously for expected indian be nowhere to be seen in meanwhile a stept cautiously along island be fifty yard in length breadth sens accustomed a be to such sight must not help dwelling on exquisite beauty of scene on garden of gay flower of imaginable form hue fringed boulder at foot peeping out amid delicate fern fan luxuriant cushion of moss on chequered shade of palm cool air wafted down from cataract above scent of thousand flower gradually ear became accustomed to roar above mighty undertone must hear whisper of wind among shrub hum of myriad insect while rock manakin with saffron plumage flitted before from stone to stone calling cheerily seeming to lead on suddenly scrambling over rocky flower bed to other side of isle came upon little shady beach beneath bank of stone six foot high fringed edge of perfectly still glassy bay ten yard farther cataract fell sheer in thunder high fern fringed rock turned force away from that quiet nook in water swung slowly round round in glassy dark green ring among dimpled hundred gaudy fish waiting for fly worm spun quivered on eddy here if anywhere be place to find owner of canoe leapt down upon pebble a did so figure rose from behind neighboring rock met face to face be indian girl yet when looked again be indian girl amyas have seen hundred of delicate dark skinned daughter of forest never one a stature be taller limb be fuller more rounded complexion though tanned by light be fairer by far than own sunburnt face hair crowned with garland of white flower be not lank straight black like indian of rich glossy brown curling richly crisply from very temple to knee forehead though low be upright ample nose be straight small lip lip of european whole face of highest richest type of spanish beauty collar of gold mingled with green bead hung round neck golden bracelet be on wrist strange dim legend of white indian of nation of higher race than carib arrowak solimo amyas have ever heard rose up in memory must be daughter of great cacique perhaps of lost inca why not full of simple wonder gazed upon fairy vision while unabashed in free innocence gazed fearlessly in return a eve might have done in paradise upon mighty stature strange garment above on bushy beard flowing yellow lock of englishman spoke first in indian tongue gently smilingly made half step forward quick a light caught up from ground bow held fiercely toward fitted with long arrow with a must see have be striking fish for line of twisted grass hung from barbed head amyas stopped laid down own bow sword made step in advance smiling still making indian sign of amity arrow be still pointed straight at breast knew mettle strength of forest nymph well enough to stand still call for indian boy too proud to retreat in uncomfortable expectation of feeling moment shaft quivering between rib boy who have be peering from above leaped down to in moment began a safest method grovelling on nose upon pebble while tried two three dialect one of at last seemed to understand answered in tone of evident suspicion anger what doe say that be spaniard robber because have beard tell that be spaniard that hate be come across great water to help indian to kill boy translated speech nymph answered by contemptuous shake of head tell that if will send tribe to will do harm be going over mountain to fight spaniard want to show way boy have sooner spoken than nimble a deer nymph have sprung up rock darted between palm stem to canoe suddenly caught sight of english boat stopped with cry of fear rage let pas shouted amyas who have followed close push boat off let pas boy tell to go on will not come near hesitated still with arrow drawn to head faced first on boat crew then on amyas till englishman have shoved off full twenty yard then leaping into tiny piragua darted into wildest whirl of eddy shooting along with vigorous stroke while english trembled a saw frail bark spinning leaping amid muzzle of alligator huge dog toothed trout with swiftness of arrow reached northern bank drove canoe among bush leaping from darted through narrow opening in bush vanished like dream what fair virago have unearthed cried cary a toiled up again to landing place beshrew quoth jack be in very land of nymph will expect to see diana next with moon on forehead take care then where wander hereabouts sir john lest end a actaeon did by turning into stag being eaten by jaguar actaeon be eaten by own hound mr cary so parallel hold surely be very wonder of beauty why be that amyas did not like harmless talk there have come over strangest new feeling a if fair vision be property men have right to talk about right to have even seen spoke quite surlily a said may leave woman to master will have to deal with men ere long so get canoe up on rock keep good watch hillo shouted one in few minute here fresh fish enough to feed round suppose that young cat mountain left behind in hurry wish have left golden chain ouches into bargain well said will take a fair payment for having made drop down current again to let ladyship pas leave fish alone said amyas be none of yours why sir finder in tone of sulky deprecation if be to make good friend with heathen have better not begin by stealing good there be plenty more fish in river go catch let indian have own men be accustomed enough to strict stern justice in dealing with savage must not help looking slyly at other hinting when out of sight that captain seemed in mighty fuss about new acquaintance however be expert by time in indian fishing method so abundant be animal life swarmed around rock that in hour fish enough lay on beach to feed whose form color name family must leave reader to guess from wondrous page of sir richard schomburgk for know too little of to speak without fear of making mistake full hour passed before saw anything more of indian neighbor then from under bush shot out canoe on eye be fixed in expectation amyas who expected to find there remnant of higher race be disappointed enough at seeing on board only usual half dozen of low browed dirty orsons painted red with arnotto gray headed elder at stern seemed by feather gold ornament to be man of note in little woodland community canoe came close up to island amyas saw that be unarmed laying down weapon advanced alone to bank making sign of amity be returned with interest by old man amyas next care be to bring forward fish fair nymph have left behind through medium of indian lad to give cacique for so seemed to be to understand that wished to render one own offer be received a amyas expected with great applause canoe came alongside crew still seemed afraid to land amyas bade men throw fish one by one into boat then proclaimed by boy mouth a be custom with indian that be enemy of spaniard on way to make war against that desired be peaceable safe passage through dominion of mighty potentate renowned warrior whom beheld before for amyas argued rightly enough that even if old fellow aft be not cacique must be none le pleased at being mistaken for whereon ancient worthy rising in canoe pointed to heaven earth thing under commenced long sermon in tone manner articulation very like one of great black bearded ape be in habit of preaching evening when must get together congregation of little monkey to listen to great scandal of jack who must have that evil spirit set on to mimic sermon being partly interpreted by indian lad seemed to signify that valor justice of white men have already reached ear of speaker that be sent to welcome into region by daughter of sun daughter of sun quoth amyas then have found lost inca after have found something said cary only hope may not be mare nest like many of finding adder said yeo must beware of treachery must beware of such thing said amyas pretty sharply have not told fifty time that if see that trust will trust if see that suspect will suspect when two party be watching to see who strike first blow be sure to come to fisticuffs from mere dirty fear of other amyas spoke truth for almost atrocity against savage have be committed by spaniard be in later worse time committed by english be wont to be excused in same base fear of treachery amyas plan like of drake cook great english voyager have be all along to inspire at once awe confidence by frank fearless carriage be not disappointed here bade men step boldly into canoe follow old indian whither must simple child of forest bowed reverently before mighty stranger then led smilingly across stream through narrow passage in covert to hidden lagoon on bank of stood not manoa tiny indian village chapter xxiv how amyas be tempted of devil let alone what pleasure can have to war with evil be there peace in always climbing up climbing wave thing have rest ripen toward grave in silence ripen fall cease give long rest death dark death dreamful ease tennyson humboldt have somewhere curious passage in looking on wretched group of indian squatting stupidly round fire besmeared with grease paint devouring ant clay somewhat naively remark be not for science teach that such be crude material of humanity state from have risen must have be tempted rather to look upon hapless being a last degraded remnant of fallen dying race one wish that great traveller have be bold enough to yield to temptation own reason common sense presented to a real explanation of sad sight instead of following dogma of so called science have not fact whereon to base wild notion must ignore thousand fact in asserting own good sense seems coincided instinctively with bible doctrine man in state of nature be fallen being doomed to death view may be sad one still one more honorable to poor humanity than theory that began a sort of two handed ape be surely more hopeful to believe that poor otomacs guahibas be not what ought to be than to believe that be be certainly more complimentary to to think that have be somewhat nobler more prudent in century gone by than that be such blockhead a to have dragged on son after father for thousand of year have elapsed since man be made without having have wit enough to discover better food than ant clay voyager however like of time troubled head with such question taking bible story a found agreed with humboldt reason not with science to speak correctly agreed with humboldt self not with willow anthropologic theory happened to be in vogue fifty year ago new host be in eye immortal soul like captivated by devil at will lost there in pathless forest likely to be lost hereafter certainly fact seemed to bear out old fashioned theory although indian have sunk by mean so low a guahibas whom have met upon lower water of same river beheld on landing scattered village of palm leaf shed under a usual hammock be slung from tree to tree here there in opening in forest patch of cassava indigo appeared there be look of neatness comfort about little settlement superior to average now for sign of evil spirit certainly be good spirit who have inspired with art of music else a cary said apollo mercury if ever visited america have played forefather shabby trick put off with very poor instrument still poorer taste for on side of landing place be arranged four five stout fellow with tall drum long earthen trumpet swelling out in course of length into several hollow ball from arose moment stranger set foot on shore so deafening cacophony of howl groan thump a fully to justify yeo remark be calling upon devil sir to cary answered with show of reason that be le likely to be disappointed for none sir urian must ever come to listen to noise mark sir said yeo there be feast sacrifice toward be not overconfident of yet nonsense said amyas must kill soul of in hour know that a well a great demonstration be plainly toward for child of forest be arrayed in two line right left of open space men in front woman behind bedizened to best of power with arnotto indigo feather next with hideous yell leapt into centre of space personage who certainly must not have complained if one have taken for devil for have dressed up carefully for very intent in jaguar skin with long tail grinning teeth pair of horn plume of black yellow feather huge rattle here be piache rascal say amyas ay say yeo in satan livery have doubt work be according trust for be frightened jack say cary backing up brimblecombe from behind be business to tackle know at boldly will run whereat men laughed piache who have intended to produce very solemn impression hung fire little however being accustomed to get bread by impudence soon recovered advanced smote one of musician over head with rattle to procure silence then began harangue to amyas listened patiently cigar in mouth what be about boy want to know whether have seen amalivaca on other shore of great water amyas be accustomed to inquiry after mythic civilizer of forest indian who after carving mysterious sculpture appear upon so many inland cliff of region returned again whence came beyond ocean answered a usual by setting praise of queen elizabeth to piache replied that must be one of amalivaca seven daughter of whom took back with while broke leg of rest to prevent running away left to people forest to amyas replied that queen leg be certainly not broken for be very model of grace activity best dancer in dominion that be more important to to know whether tribe must give cassava bread let stay peaceably on island to rest while before went on to fight clothed men spaniard on other side of mountain on piache after capering turning head over heel with much howling beckoned amyas party to follow did so seeing that indian be unarmed evidently in highest good humor piache went toward door of carefully closed hut crawling up to on four in most abject fashion began whining to one within ask what be about boy lad asked old cacique who have accompanied received for answer that be consulting daughter of sun here be mare nest at last quoth cary a piache from whine rose to scream gesticulation then to violent convulsion foaming at mouth rolling of eyeball till suddenly sank exhausted lay for dead a good a stage play devil have played part say jack now by rule of play vice must come on very fair vice will be suspect right sweet iniquity jack listen from interior of hut rose low sweet song at simple indian bowed head in reverence english be hushed in astonishment for voice be not shrill guttural like of indian round clear rich like european a swelled rose louder louder showed compass power must have be extraordinary anywhere many man of party a be usual in musical old england be good judge enough of matter must hold part right well in glee catch roundelay psalm a leaped ran sank again rose once more to fall once more inarticulate yet perfect in melody like voice of bird on bough wild wanderer be rapt in new delight did not wonder at indian a bowed head welcomed note a messenger from higher world at last one triumphant burst so shrill that ear rang again then dead silence piache suddenly restored to life jumped upright recommenced preaching at amyas tell howling villain to make short work of lad tune wo do after last one lad grinning informed amyas that piache signified acceptance a friend by daughter of sun that friend be theirs foe theirs whereon indian set up scream of delight amyas rolling tobacco leaf up in strip of plantain answered then let give cassava lighted fresh cigar whereon door of hut opened indian prostrated to earth a there came forth same fair apparition have encountered upon island decked now in feather robe plume of imaginable hue slowly stately a one accustomed to command walked up to amyas glancing proudly round on prostrate adorer pointing with graceful arm to tree garden hut gave to understand by sign so expressive be look that word be needed that be at service after taking hand lifted gently to forehead at sign of submission shout of rapture rose from crowd a mysterious maiden retired again to hut pressed round english caressing admiring pointing with equal surprise to sword to indian bow blow gun to trophy of wild beast with be clothed while woman hastened off to bring fruit flower cassava to amyas great anxiety calabash of intoxicating drink to make long story short english sat down beneath tree feasted merrily while drum trumpet made hideous music lithe young girl lad danced uncouth dance so scandalized brimblecombe yeo that persuaded amyas to beat early retreat be willing enough to get back to island while men be still sober so there be many leave taking promise of return on morrow party paddled back to island fortress racking wit a to who what mysterious maid must be amyas however have settled in mind that be one of lost inca race perhaps descendant of very fair girl wife of inca manco whom pizarro forty year before have merely to torture fugitive king heart a body be safe from tyrant reach stripped scourged shot to death with arrow uncomplaining to last assembled for evening service hardly day have passed since left england on have not done same after be over must need sing psalm then catch two ere went to sleep till moon be high in heaven twenty mellow voice rang out above roar of cataract in many good old tune once twice thought heard echo to song took note of till cary who have gone apart for few minute returned whispered amyas away sweet iniquity be mimicking lad went to brink of river there for ear be by time dead to noise of torrent must hear plainly same voice have so surprised in hut repeating clear true snatch of air have sung strange solemn enough be effect of men deep voice on island answered out of dark forest by sweet treble note two young men stood long while listening looking out across eddy swirled down golden in moonlight must see nothing beyond save black wall of tree after while voice ceased two returned to dream of inca nightingale visited village again next day day for week more maiden appeared rarely when did kept distance a haughtily a queen amyas of course a soon a must converse somewhat better with new friend be not long before questioned cacique about old man made owl face at name intimated by mysterious shake of head that be very strange personage le said about better be child of sun be enough tell boy cary that be child of sun by first wife have order from to inquire how indian have full mile down stream a if in fear that wonderful maiden must overhear told in sort of rhythmic chant how many moon ago must not tell how many tribe be mighty nation dwelt in papamene till spaniard drove forth how a wandered northward far away upon mountain spur beneath flaming cone of cotopaxi have found fair creature wandering in forest about bigness of seven year child wondering at white skin delicate beauty simple indian worshipped a god led home with when found that be human like wonder scarcely lessened how must so tender being have sustained life in forest escaped jaguar snake must be under divine protection must be daughter of sun one of mighty inca race news of whose fearful fall have reached even lonely wilderness who have many of haunted for year a exile eastern slope of andes about ucalayi maranon who must a indian knew rise again day to power when bearded white men must come across sea to restore to ancient throne so a girl grew up among be tended with royal honor by command of conjuror of tribe so forefather sun might be propitious to inca might show favor to poor ruined omaguas in day of coming glory a grew have become seemed somewhat of prophetess among a well a object of fetish worship for be more prudent in council valiant in war cunning in chase than elder of tribe strange sweet song of hers have so surprised white men be full of mysterious wisdom about bird animal flower river sun good spirit taught from above so have lived among unmarried still not only because despised address of indian youth because conjuror have declared to be profane in to mingle with race of sun have assigned cabin near own where be served in state gave sort of oracular response a have seen to question put to such be cacique tale on cary remarked probably not unjustly that dared to say conjuror made very good thing of amyas be silent full of dream if not about manoa still about remnant of inca race what if be still to be found about southern source of amazon must have be very near already in case be vexatious at least might be sure that have formed no great kingdom in direction must have heard of long ago perhaps have moved lately from thence eastward to escape fresh encroachment of spaniard girl have be left behind in flight then recollected with sigh how hopeless be further search with diminished band at least might learn something of truth from maiden might be useful to in future attempt for have not yet given up manoa if got safe home there be many gallant gentleman raleigh came at once into mind who must join in fresh search for golden city of guiana not by upper water by mouth of orinoco so paddled back while simple cacique entreated to tell sun in daily prayer how well wild people have treated descendant besought not to take away with lest sun must forget poor omaguas ripen manioc fruit more amyas have wish to stay where be longer than be absolutely necessary to bring up sick men from orinoco well knew must be journey probably of month attended with much danger cary volunteered at once however to undertake adventure if dozen men must join indian must send few young men to help in working canoe latter item be not easy one to obtain for tribe with whom now be stood in fear of fierce brutal guahibas through whose country must pas indian tribe a amyas knew well enough look on tribe of different language to a natural enemy hateful made only to be destroyed wherever met strange fact too amyas party attributed to delusion of devil divider accuser be of opinion that be perfectly right only let amyas take care that while be discovering devil in indian doe not give place to in that in more way than one of more hereafter whether however be pride shyness kept maiden aloof conquered after while perhaps through mere woman curiosity perhaps too from mere longing for amusement in place so unspeakably stupid a forest gave english to understand however that though might be very important personage none of be to be companion amyas ere month be past be often hunting with far wide in neighboring forest with train of chosen nymph whom have persuaded to follow example spurn dusky suitor around fashion not uncommon perhaps among indian tribe where woman be continually escaping to forest from tyranny of men often perhaps forming temporary community be to english plain proof that be near land of famous amazon of whom have heard so often from indian while amyas have doubt that a descendant of inca maiden preserved tradition of virgin of sun of austere monastic rule of peruvian superstition have not that valiant german george of spire jeronimo ortal too fifty year before found convent of sun upon very upper water so harmless friendship sprang up between amyas girl soon turned to good account for sooner heard that needed crew of indian than consulted piache assembled tribe having retired to hut commenced song unless piache lied be command to furnish young men for cary expedition under penalty of sovereign displeasure of evil spirit with unpronounceable name argument succeeded on spot canoe departed on perilous errand john brimblecombe have great doubt whether venture thus started by direct help patronage of fiend must succeed amyas disliking humbug told ayacanora that must be better to have told tribe that be good deed pleasing to good spirit ah said naively enough know better than that good spirit be big lazy smile take trouble little bad spirit be so busy here there everywhere waved pretty hand up down be useful one to have for friend sentiment piache much approved a became occupation once told brimblecombe pretty sharply that be meddlesome fellow for telling indian that good spirit cared for for quoth if begin to ask good spirit for what want who will bring cassava coca for keeping bad spirit quiet argument however forcible devil priest in age have felt to be did not stop jack preaching very good righteous preaching be moreover much le morning evening service in island camp last indian attracted by singing attended in such number that piache found occupation gone vowed to put end to jack gospel with poisoned arrow plan blinded by master satan so jack phrased took into head to impart to ayacanora a partner of tithe offering be exceedingly astonished to receive in answer box on ear storm of abuse after ayacanora went to amyas telling proposed that piache must be thrown to alligator jack installed in place declaring that bearded men said must be true plotted against must die death jack however magnanimously forgave foe preached on of course with fresh zeal not ala with much success for conjuror though main treasure be gone over to camp of enemy have reserve in certain holy trumpet be hidden mysteriously in cave on neighboring hill not to be looked on by woman under pain of death be well known have be known for generation unless trumpet after fasting flagellation other solemn rite be blown by night throughout wood palm tree must bear fruit yea so great be fame of trumpet that neighboring tribe sent at proper season to hire blower thereof by payment of much precious trumpery so might be sharer in fertilizing power so piache announced one day in public that in consequence of impiety of omaguas must retire to neighboring tribe of more religious turn of mind taking with precious instrument leave palm to blight to evil spirit dire be wailing dire wrath throughout village jack word be allowed to be good word what be gospel in comparison of trumpet rascal saw advantage began fierce harangue against heretic stranger a maddened hearer maddened savage nature capricious a child flashed out in wild suspicion woman yelled men scowled ran hastily to hut for bow blow gun case be grown critical there be not more than dozen men with amyas at time have only sword while indian men might muster nearly hundred amyas forbade men to draw to retreat poisoned arrow be weapon before boldest might well quail more than one cheek grew pale have seldom be pale before be god quarrel sir said jack brimblecombe let defend right a spoke from ayacanora hut arose magic song quivered aloft among green height of forest mob stood spell bound still growling fiercely not daring to move moment have rushed out like very diana into centre of ring bow in hand arrow on string fallen child of wrath have found match in for beautiful face be convulsed with fury almost foaming in passion burst forth with bitter revilings pointed with admiration to english then with fiercest contempt to indian at last with fierce gesture seemed to cast off very dust of foot against springing to amyas side placed in forefront of english battle whole scene be so sudden that amyas have hardly discovered whether came a friend foe before bow be raised have just time to strike up hand when arrow flew past ear of offending piache stuck quivering in tree let kill wretch said stamping with rage amyas held arm firmly fool cried to tribe while tear of anger rolled down cheek choose between trumpet be daughter of sun be white be companion for englishman mother be guahibas ate mud father be howling ape let sing to will go to white men never sing to sleep more when little evil spirit miss voice will come tumble out of hammock make dream of ghost night till grow a thin a blow gun a stupid a aye ayes two toed sloth terrible counter threat in spite of slight bathos involved have effect for appealed to dread of sleep world be common to savage conjuror be ready to outbid prophetess have begun fresh oration when amyas turned tide of war bursting into huge laugh at whole matter took conjuror by shoulder sent with one crafty kick dozen yard off upon nose then walking out of rank shook hand round with indian acquaintance whereon like grown up baby burst out laughing too shook hand with english then with other being after a glad a bishop to prorogue convocation let unpleasant question stand over till next session piache relented like prudent man ayacanora returned to hut to sulk amyas to island to long for cary return for felt on dangerous ground at last will returned safe sound a merry a ever not having lost man though have have smart brush with guahibas brought back three of wounded men now pretty nigh cured other two who have lost leg apiece have refused to come have indian wife more than must eat tobacco without end if be not for gnat of cary said that there be more mosquito than there be air must be happiest men alive amyas must hardly blame poor fellow for chance of getting home through forest with one leg be very small after be making best of bad matter very bad matter seemed to to be left in heathen land still worse matter when overheard of men talking about comrade lonely fate a if after be not so much to be pitied said nothing about then for made rule never to take notice of fact got at by eavesdropping however unintentional longed that one of must say a much to must give piece of mind piece of mind have to give within week for while be on hunting party two of men be missing be not heard of for day at end of time old cacique come to tell that believed have taken to forest with indian girl amyas be very wroth at news first because have never happened before must say with honest pride a raleigh did afterwards when returned from guiana voyage that indian woman have ever be worse for man of have preached on point month after month practised what preached now pride be sorely hurt moreover dreaded offence to indian on score cacique soon comforted telling that girl a far a must find have gone off of own free will intimating that thought somewhat honor to tribe that have found favor in eye of bearded men moreover late war have so thinned rank of men that be glad enough to find husband for maiden have be driven of late year to kill many of female infant sad story common perhaps to american tribe one of chief cause of extermination reassured amyas somewhat must not stomach loss of men breach of discipline look for must did one know where be if tribe knew did not care to tell ayacanora moment found out wish vanished into forest returned in two day saying that have found fugitive must not show where be unless promised not to kill of course have mind for so rigorous method needed men have malice against for one ebsworthy be plain honest happy go lucky sailor a good hand a there be in crew other be that same ne'er do weel will parracombe old schoolfellow who have be tempted by gipsy jesuit at appledore resisting that bait have made very fair seaman so forth amyas went with ayacanora a guide five mile upward along forest slope till girl whispered there be amyas pushing gently through thicket of bamboo beheld scene in spite of wrath kept silent perhaps softened for minute on farther side of little lawn stream leapt through chasm beneath overarching vine sprinkling eternal freshness upon around then sank foaming into clear rock basin bath for dian self on farther side crag rose twenty foot in height bank upon bank of feathered fern cushioned moss over rich green bed of drooped thousand orchid scarlet white orange made still pool gorgeous with reflection of gorgeousness at more quiet outfall be half hidden in huge fantastic leaf tall flowering stem near waterfall grassy bank sloped down toward stream there on palm leaf strewed upon turf beneath shadow of crag lay two men whom amyas sought whom now have found have hardly heart to wake from delicious dream for what nest be have found air be heavy with scent of flower quivering with murmur of stream humming of colibris insect cheerful song of bird gentle cooing of hundred dove while now then from far away musical wail of sloth deep toll of bell bird came softly to ear what be not there eye ear must need what palate must need either for on rock above strange tree leaning forward dropped now then luscious apple upon grass below huge wild plantain bent beneath load of fruit there on stream bank lay two renegade from civilized life have cast away clothes painted like indian with arnotto indigo one lay lazily picking up fruit fell close to side other sat back against cushion of soft moss hand folded languidly upon lap giving up to soft influence of narcotic coca juice with half shut dreamy eye fixed on everlasting sparkle of waterfall while beauty born of murmuring sound did pas into face somewhat apart crouched two dusky bride crowned with fragrant flower working busily like true woman for lord whom delighted to honor one sat plaiting palm fibre into basket other be boring stem of huge milk tree rose like mighty column on right hand of lawn broad canopy of leaf unseen through dense underwood of laurel bamboo betokened only by rustle far aloft by mellow shade in bathed whole delicious scene amyas stood silent for awhile partly from noble shame at seeing two christian men thus fallen of own self will partly because must not confess that solemn calm brooded above glorious place to break through seemed sacrilege even while felt duty such thought be paradise of old such first parent bridal bower ah if man have not fallen too might have dwelt forever in such home with whom started shaking off spell advanced sword in hand woman saw springing to foot caught up long pocunas leapt like deer in front of beloved there stood deadly tube pressed to lip eyeing like tigress who protect young while slender limb quivered not with terror with rage amyas paused half in admiration half in prudence for one rash step be death rushing through cane ayacanora sprang to front shrieked to in indian at sight of prophetess woman wavered amyas putting on a gentle face a must stepped forward assuring in best indian that must harm one ebsworthy parracombe be grown such savage already that have forgotten captain stand up men salute ebsworthy sprang to foot obeyed mechanically then slipped behind bride again a if in shame dreamer turned head languidly raised hand to forehead then returned to contemplation amyas rested point of sword on ground hand upon hilt looked sadly solemnly upon pair ebsworthy broke silence half reproachfully half trying to bluster away coming storm well noble captain so have hunted out poor fellow want to drag back again in halter suppose came to look for christian find heathen for men find swine will leave heathen to wilderness swine to trough parracombe be too happy to answer sir why not what do want of two year vow be out be free men now free to become like beast perish be queen servant still in name charge free to be happy interrupted man with best of wife best of food warmer bed than duke finer garden than emperor a for clothes why plague must man wear where need a for gold what be use of where heaven sends everything ready made to hand hearken captain leigh have be good captain to will repay with bit of sound advice give up gold hunting toiling moiling after honor glory copy take fair maid behind there to wife pitch here with see if be not happier in one day than ever be in life before be drunk sirrah william parracombe will speak to will heave into stream to sober who call william parracombe answered sleepy voice fool captain be not william parracombe be dead long ago of hunger labor heavy sorrow will never see bideford town more be turned into indian now be to sleep sleep sleep for hundred year till get strength again poor fellow awake then thou that sleepest arise from dead christ will give thee light christened englishman living thus life of beast christ will give thee light answered same unnatural abstracted voice yes so parson say say too that be lord of heaven earth must have thought light be a near here a anywhere nearer too by look of place look round said waving lazy hand see work of god place of paradise whither poor weary soul go home rest after master in wicked world have used up with labor sorrow made wade knee deep in blood be tired of blood tired of gold will march more will fight no more will hunger more after vanity vexation of spirit what will get by maybe will leave bone in wilderness can do here maybe will get home with few pezos to die old cripple in stinking hovel that monkey must scorn to lodge in here may go on will pay may be rich man knight live in fine house drink good wine go to court torment soul with trying to get more when have got too much already plotting planning to scramble upon neighbor shoulder a did sir richard mr raleigh chichester poor dear old sir warham of used to watch when lived before be happier than be then will warrant be happier now go way captain climb to glory upon other back than ours leave here in peace alone with god god wood good wife that god have given to play little like school child be long since have have play hour now will be little child once more with flower singing bird silver fish in stream be at peace think harm want clothes money knighthood peerage just take what come heavenly father feedeth solomon in glory be not arrayed like one of will not much more feed be of more value than many sparrow will live here shut out from christian ordinance christian ordinance adam eve have parson in paradise lord be priest lord be shepherd will be ours too go way sir send up sir john brimblecombe let marry here church fashion though have sworn troth to other before god already let give holy sacrament once for then read funeral service over go way count for dead sir for dead be to wicked worthless world came out of three year ago when lord chooses to call little bird will cover with leaf a did baby in wood fresher flower will grow out of graf sir than out of yours in bare northam churchyard there beyond weary weary weary sea voice died away to murmur head sank on breast amyas stood spell bound effect of narcotic be miraculous in eye sustained eloquence novel richness of diction in one seemingly drowned in sensual sloth be in eye possession of evil spirit yet must not answer evil one english heart full of divine instinct of duty public spirit told that must be lie how to prove lie stood for full ten minute searching for answer seemed to fly farther farther off more sought for eye glanced upon ayacanora two girl be whispering to smilingly saw one of glance look toward then say something raised beautiful blush in maiden face with playful blow at speaker turned away amyas knew instinctively that be giving same advice a ebsworthy have given to oh how beautiful be might not renegade have reason on side after shuddered at thought must not shake off glided in like gaudy snake wreathed coil round heart brain drew back to other side of lawn thought thought must ever get home if did might not get home beggar beggar rich must still have to face mother to go through meeting to tell tale perhaps to hear reproach forecast of have weighed on like dark thunder cloud for two weary year to wipe out by desperate deed of glory have wandered wilderness wandered in vain must not settle here need not be savage might christianize civilize teach equal law mercy in war chivalry to woman found community might be hereafter a strong barrier against encroachment of spaniard a manoa must have be who knew wealth of surrounding forest even if there be gold there be boundless vegetable treasure what might not export down river might be nucleus of great commercial settlement yet be even that worth while to settle here only to torment soul with fresh scheme fresh ambition not to rest only to change one labor for be not dreamer right did not need rest what if sat down among flower beside indian bride might live like christian while lived like bird of heaven what dead silence looked up round bird have ceased to chirp parroquet be hiding behind leaf monkey be clustered motionless upon highest twig only out of far depth of forest campanero gave solemn toll once twice thrice like great death knell rolling down from far cathedral tower be omen looked up hastily at ayacanora be watching earnestly heaven be waiting for decision dropped eye decision be not to come from rustle roar shriek amyas lifted eye in time to see huge dark bar shoot from crag above dreamer head among group of girl dull crash a group flew asunder in midst upon ground tawny limb of one be writhing beneath fang of black jaguar rarest most terrible of forest king of one of be ayacanora sword in hand amyas rushed madly forward before reached spot tortured limb be still be not ayacanora for with shriek rang through wood wretched dreamer wakened thus at last sprang up felt for sword fool have left in hammock screaming name of dead bride rushed on jaguar a crouched above prey seizing head with teeth nail worried in ferocity of madness like mastiff dog brute wrenched head from grasp raised dreadful paw moment husband corpse must have lain by wife high in air gleamed amyas blade down with weight of huge body strong arm fell that most trusty steel head of jaguar dropped grinning on victim corpse stood still who saw fall while men might count score o lord jesus said amyas to thou hast answered devil for be selfish rest for must have bartered rest come by working where thou hast put bore away lithe corpse into forest buried under soft moss virgin mould so fair clay be transfigured into fairer flower poor gentle untaught spirit returned to god who gave then amyas went sadly silently back again parracombe walked after like one who walk in sleep ebsworthy sobered by shock entreated to come too amyas forbade gently lad be forgiven god forbid must judge man sir john will come up marry then if still be will to stay lord forgive if be wrong in meanwhile will leave with all that can spare stay here pray to god to make too wiser men so amyas departed have come out stern proud came back again like little child three day after parracombe be dead once in camp seemed unable to eat move having received absolution communion from good sir john faded away without disease pain babbling of green field murmuring name of lost indian bride amyas too sought ghostly council of sir john told have passed through mind be indeed temptation of diabolus said that simple sage for be by very name divider who set man against man tempts one to care only for forget kin country duty queen have resisted captain leigh like true born englishman a always be have fled from be reason why must not flee from too so think sooner be out of place at work again better for soul to amyas most devoutly said amen if ayacanora be daughter of ten thousand inca must get out of way a soon a possible next day announced intention to march once more to delight found men ready enough to move towards spanish settlement one thing needed gunpowder for musket that must make a went along be if must get material charcoal must procure enough to set world on fire nitre have not yet seen perhaps must find among hill while a for sulphur brave man must get that where there be volcano who have not heard how one of cortez ' spaniard in like need be lowered in basket down smoking crater of popocatepetl till have gathered sulphur enough to conquer empire what spaniard must do englishman must do must by piache too who be glad enough to be rid of rival preacher unpleasantly good news that men need not worship devil because there be good god above maiden sang most melodious assent whole tribe echoed fair asked white man love gold get poor indian what use be gold to only want something to eat must eat enemy what else will pay for going so far through forest hungry thirsty will get omaguas will get nothing argument be unanswerable next day started without indian while john brimblecombe heaved many honest sigh at leaving to darkness devil holy trumpet ayacanora when departure be determined shut papamene ayacanora took part in amyas left wondering at absence joyful light hearted at having escaped rock of siren being at work once more chapter xxv how took gold train god will relent quit thee thy debt who ever more approves more accepts who imploring mercy sue for life than who self rigorous chooses death a due argues over just displeased for self offence more than for god offended samson agonistes fortnight more have passed in severe toil not more severe than have endured many time before bidding farewell once forever to green ocean of eastern plain have crossed cordillera have taken longing glance at city of santa fe lying in midst of rich garden on lofty mountain plateau have seen a be to be expected that be far too large place for attempt of theirs have not altogether thrown river at point where seemed broad still enough for navigation for three day have not seen trace of human being spot seemed lonely enough for to encamp without fear of discovery begin making of canoe began to spread along stream in search of soft wooded tree proper for purpose hardly have search begun when in midst of dense thicket came upon sight filled with astonishment beneath honeycombed cliff supported one enormous cotton tree be spot of thirty yard square sloping down to stream planted in row with magnificent banana plant full twelve foot high bearing among huge waxy leaf cluster of ripening fruit while under mellow shade yam cassava plant be flourishing luxuriantly whole being surrounded by hedge of orange scarlet flower there lay streaked with long shadow from setting sun while cool southern air rustled in cotton tree flapped to fro great banana leaf tiny paradise of art care where be inhabitant aroused by noise of approach figure issued from cave in rock after gazing at for moment came down garden towards be tall stately old man whose snow white beard hair covered chest shoulder while lower limb be wrapt in indian web slowly solemnly approached staff in one hand string of bead in other living likeness of old hebrew prophet anchorite of ancient legend bowed courteously to amyas who of course returned salute be in act to speak when eye fell upon indian who be laying down burden in heap under tree mild countenance assumed instantly expression of acutest sorrow displeasure striking hand together spoke in spanish ala miserable ala unhappy senor do old eye deceive be on a said be mad with blood none more mad than surely be fable that men be possessed even in latter age by devil why else did rejoice in slaying why else be son of noble truthful cavalier of castile among foremost to urge upon general murder of inca why did rejoice over dying agony why when don ferdinando de soto returned upbraided with villainy did instead of confessing sin that noble cavalier cavalier amyas be silent old gentleman saw that have touched sore point continued why again senor did after day give up to cruelty a to sport yea thought that did god service by destroying creature whom have made who now dare not destroy gnat lest harm being more righteous than be mad if be how then be that while a prudent a be day be not here to argue senor to confess in word there be deed of than day blush to tell two brother of whom spoke quarrelled for possession of struck other senor who struck first know not sword be drawn cavalier round parted cry shame one of two brother one who speaks to now cry 'if can not have man will ' turned sword be aimed at brother against hapless maiden hear out senor before flee from presence a from that of monster stabbed to heart a died one moment more senor may confess looked up in face with smile a of heaven thanked for having rid once for from christian villainy old man paused god forgive senor said jack brimblecombe softly then turn from curse then will try farther still senor will know from human lip whether man can do such deed a have done yet be pitied by kind that so may have hope that where man have mercy god may have mercy also do think that repented at awful word nothing le senor more than did when de soto on whose soul god have mercy called liar knew sinner for very reason be determined to sin must go on might prove right to myself by showing must go on not be struck dead from heaven out of mere pride senor self will must fill up cup of iniquity filled know doubtless senor how after death of old almagro son party have be opened must not afford to lose men for a far a knew spaniard left on board might still far outnumber english so up sprang on poop followed by dozen men there began very heavy fight between two party of valiant warrior who easily knew other apart by peculiar fashion of armor for spaniard fought in shirt in other garment english in other manner of garment tag rag bobtail yet have never shirt between rest of english made rush of course to get upon poop seeing that spaniard must not shoot through deck fire from window be so hot that although dodged behind mast spar possible shelter one two dropped jack brimblecombe yeo took on to call retreat with about dozen men got back held council of war what be to be done arquebus be of little use for spaniard be behind strong bulkhead there be cannon where be powder shot boat encouraged by clamor on deck be paddling alongside again yeo rushed round round probing gun with sword here be patararo loaded now for match lad luckily one of english have kept match alight during scuffle thanks be help to unship gun mast in way here patararo brass swivel be unshipped steady lad keep will shake out priming ship here turn out that one heave into boat if come alongside steady now so rummage about find bolt two marlin spike anything quick captain will be over mastered yet missile be found odds end crammed into swivel up to muzzle in minute cargo of notion be crashing into poop window silencing fire from thence effectually enough for time now then rush forward right in along deck shouted yeo whole party charged through cabin door shot have burst open hewed way from room to room in meanwhile spaniard above have fought fiercely in spite of superior number have gradually given back before demoniacal possession of blasphemous heretic who fought not like men like fury from pit by time brimblecombe yeo shouted from stern gallery below quarter deck be won few on side have shrewd scratch to show yield senor shouted amyas to commander who have be fighting like lion back to back with captain of mariner never have bound insulted blood mine must wipe out stain rushed on amyas there be few moment heavy fence between then amyas cut right at head a raised arm spaniard blade slipped along rib snapped against point of shoulder blade inch more to left must have be through heart blow fell nevertheless commandant fell with stunned by flat of sword not wounded for amyas hand have turned a winced from wound sea captain seeing amyas stagger sprang at seizing by wrist ere must raise sword again shortened weapon to run through amyas made grasp at wrist in return between faintness darkness missed moment must have be over bright blade flashed close past amyas ear sea captain grasp loosened dropped corpse while over like angry lioness above prey stood ayacanora long hair floating in wind dagger raised aloft a looked round challenging one to approach be hurt panted scratch child what do do here go back go back ayacanora slipped back like scolded child vanished in darkness battle be over spaniard seeing commander fall laid down arm cried for quarter be given poor fellow be tied together two two seated in row on deck ambree in dark skin now then lad get santa fe gold up out of canoe then will put head to north east away for old england mr brimblecombe say that eastward ho bring luck time be impossible till morning dawned to get matter into order to overhaul prize have taken many of men be so much exhausted that fell fast asleep on deck ere surgeon have time to dress wound however amyas contrived when once ship be leaping merrily close hauled against fresh land breeze to count little flock found out of forty four six seriously wounded none killed however working number be now reduced to thirty eight beside four negro scanty crew enough to take home ship to england after awhile up came jack brimblecombe on deck bottle in hand lad prize well know already nay look hither laid in ice too a live luxurious for plundering will settle amyas walked forward among men muster men boatswain count here sir six poor fellow who be laid forward now men said amyas for three year have wandered on face of earth work with fate draw veil from hidden worth sleeping beauty so ayacanora took up abode in lucy cabin a regularly accredited member of crew most troublesome member for now began in perilous crisis seems to endanger body soul of savage savage tribe when first mingle with white man crisis few year afterwards began to hasten extermination of north american tribe have not be for admirable good sense constancy of amyas ayacanora might have ended even more miserably than did far famed pocahontas daughter of virginian king who after having be received at court by old pedant james first with honor of sister sovereign having become reputed ancestress of more than one ancient virginian family ended day in wretchedness in wapping garret for mind of savage crushed by sight of white man superior skill wealth wisdom loses at first self respect while body pampered with easily obtained luxury instead of having to win necessary of life by heavy toil loses self helpfulness with self respect self help vanish savage virtue few flimsy a be downward road toward begging stealing sottishness idleness be easy if not sure down road really seemed at first that poor ayacanora be walking fast for warrior prophetess of omaguas soon became to appearance nothing very naughty child diana of meta after have satisfied simple wonder at great floating house by rambling from deck to deck peeping into cupboard cranny manifested great propensity to steal hide be too proud too shy to ask for trumpery smit fancy when amyas forbade to take anything without leave threatened to drown went off sulked day in cabin nevertheless obeyed except in matter of sweet thing perhaps craved naturally for vegetable food of native forest at event bishop store of fruit sweetmeat diminished rapidly what be worse so did sweet spanish wine amyas have set apart for poor lucy daily cordial whereon severe lecture in amyas told how mean be to rob poor sick lucy whereat a usual threatened to drown be running upon deck to do when amyas caught forgave on violent fit of cry great penitence promise week after amyas found that have cheated satan own conscience by tormenting portuguese steward into giving other wine instead luckily for found amyas warning about wine making mad so far fulfilled that did several foolish thing one evening have bad headache next morning so murder be out amyas ordered steward up for sound flogging ayacanora honorably enough not only begged off offered to be whipped instead of confessing that poor fellow spoke truly when swore that have threatened to kill that have given wine in bodily fear for life however own headache amyas cold look be lesson enough after attempt to drown wilful beauty settled down for awhile what be better must hardly be persuaded thenceforth to dying day to touch fermented liquor in meanwhile poor amyas have many brain beating a to how be to tame lady who on least provocation took refuge in suicide punish dared not even if have heart a for putting ashore have instinct surely not superstitious one strange affection for english be not unsent by heaven that god have committed into charge that must require account at hand of soul of fair lost lamb so almost at wit end prayed to god good simple fellow that many time to show what must do with before killed what be just a likely one of crew seemed best to to make parson jack teach rudiment of christianity that might be baptized in due time when got home to england here arose fresh trouble for roundly refused to learn of jack of one amyas while have many good reason for refusing office of schoolmaster so for week two more ayacanora remained untaught save in english tongue picked up with marvellous rapidity next a if trouble must never end took violent dislike not only to john brimblecombe whose gait voice openly mimicked for edification of men also to will cary whom never allowed to speak to approach perhaps be jealous of intimacy with amyas perhaps with subtle instinct of woman knew that be only other man on board who might dare to make love to though will to do justice be a guiltless of such intention a amyas when be remonstrated with only answer be that cary be cacique a well a amyas that there ought not to be two cacique one day actually proposed to amyas to kill supposed rival take ship to sulked for several day at hearing amyas amid shout of laughter retail precious advice to intended victim moreover negro came in for share being regarded along by with unspeakable repugnance showed at first in hiding from whenever must afterwards in throwing at everything must lay hand on till poor quashies in danger of life complained to amyas got rest for awhile over rest of sailor lorded like very princess calling from work to run on errand make toy for enforcing command now then by shrewd box on ear while good fellow especially old yeo like true sailor petted obeyed even jested with much a might have done with tame leopard whose claw might be unsheathed about ear at moment amused amused amyas too must of course have pet what prettier one must have a for amyas constant interest of presence even constant anxiety of wilfulness kept mind busy drove out many sad foreboding about meeting with mother tragedy have to tell must otherwise so heavily did weigh on have crushed spirit with melancholy made worldly success marvellous deliverance worthless in eye at last matter a most thing luckily do came to climax came in way ship have be slipping along now for many day slowly steadily before favorable breeze have passed ring of west india island be now crawling safe from pursuit through vast weed bed of sargasso sea there for first time be thought safe to relax discipline have be hitherto kept up to rummage a be word in day noble prize what found of gold silver jewel merchandise will interest reader suffice to say that there be enough there with other treasure to make amyas rich for life after claim of cary crew not forgetting mr salterne third a owner of ship have be paid off in captain cabin be found two chest one full of gorgeous mexican feather dress other of spanish east indian finery having come by way of havana cartagena be going on seemed to senora other at caracas two chest be at cary proposal voted amid acclamation of crew to ayacanora a due fit share of pillage in consideration of amazonian prowess valuable service so poor child took greedy possession of trumpery have carried into lucy cabin there knelt gloating over many hour mexican work chose to despise a savage spanish dress be treasure for two three day appeared on quarter deck sunning like peacock before eye of amyas in seville mantilla madrid hat indian brocade farthingale know not how many other gewgaw dare not say how put on crew tittered amyas felt much more inclined to cry there be nothing so pathetic a child vanity saving grown person aping child vanity saving too child agony of disappointment when find that have be laughed at instead of being admired amyas must have spoken be afraid however evil brought own cure pageant went on a actor thought most successfully for three day so at last dupe unable to contain longer appealed to amyas ayacanora quite english girl now be not heard titter behind looked round saw dozen honest face in broad grin comprehended in moment darted down companion ladder vanished amyas fully expecting to jump overboard followed a fast a must have locked in with lucy must hear violent sob lucy faint voice entreating to know what be matter in vain knocked refused to come out day at even be forced to break door open to prevent lucy being starved there sat ayacanora finery half torn off scattered about floor in spite cry still a if heart must break while poor lucy cried too half from fright hunger half for company amyas tried to comfort poor child assured that men must never laugh at again then added must not be so so what to say hardly knew so what asked cry more bitterly than ever so like wild girl ayacanora hand dropped on knee strong spasm ran through throat bosom fell on knee before looked up imploringly in face yes wild girl poor bad wild girl will be english girl now fine clothes will never make english child said amyas not english clothes english heart good heart like yours yes will be good sir john will teach there be good maid said amyas sir john will begin teach to morrow now now ayacanora can not wait will drown if be bad day come now made fetch brimblecombe honest fellow patiently for hour more told lucy that very night that have said from day whenever jack went in to read pray with poor sufferer ayacanora instead of escaping on deck a before stood patiently trying to make out knelt when knelt tried to pray too that might have english heart doubtless prayer dumb a be be not unheard so went on few day more hopefully enough without outbreak till one morning just after have passed sargasso bed ship be taking care of men be on deck under awning tinkering cobbling chatting brimblecombe be catechising fair pupil in cabin amyas cary cigar in mouth be chatting about heaven earth above of best way of getting up fresh adventure against spaniard a soon a returned while amyas be pouring out to will dark hatred of whole nation that dark purpose of revenge for brother for rose have settled down like murky cloud into cranny of heart mind suddenly there be noise below scuffle shout made leap to foot up on deck rushed jack brimblecombe holding head on with hand save save from that fiend be possessed with legion have broken nose torn out half hair be sure have none to spare here come stand by gentleman satanas defy thee jack ensconced behind pair a ayacanora whirled upon deck like very maenad seeing amyas stopped short if have defied satan down below there said cary with laugh suspect must have broken out on so boldly master jack be innocent innocent a babe unborn oh mr cary be too bad of sir jack indignantly while amyas asked what be matter looked at said sturdily well cat may look at king sha' look at ayacanora nobody will will kill in vain jack protested innocence of having even looked at fancy verily believe be nothing more have taken possession of refused to return below to lesson jack went off grumbling hair wore black eye for week after at event cary re lighting cigar be fault on right side god give grace may be one on wrong side for will old heart of oak said cary laying arm around amyas neck to evident disgust of ayacanora who went off to side got fishing line began amusing therewith while ship slipped on quietly silently a ever save when ayacanora laughed clapped hand at flying fish scudding from bonito at last tired of doing nothing went forward to poop rail to listen to john squire armorer who sat tinkering headpiece humming song mutato people knowledge of custom gained much from somewhat fantastic behaviour amyas thought good for reason of own to assume toward assigned handsome cabin to herself always addressed a madam told cary say son eye witness lackt admiral through through whereon down came offending flag due apology be made not accepted for long time by stout guardian of majesty honor if john hawkins did a much for
