different fashion a part adventurer in rose have to deliver to share of treasure have brought home share sir if understood ship be lost off coast of caracas three year agone treasure be won since true a adventurer in expedition have just claim for share will receive captain leigh be see a father be before just upright christian man money be none of mine for be won in ship of mine hear sir if have be that ship must not speak name lay safe sound now by bideford quay do think sir william salterne be man to make money out of daughter sin sorrow to handle price of blood sir went like gentleman to seek like gentleman a world know have done best thank account end there treasure be yours sir have enough more than enough none god help to leave to greedy needy kin who will be rather worse than better for if have claim in law for aught know not neither will ever ask why if be not too proud accept claim a plain burgher thank offering to sir for great noble love brother have shown to one who though say to shame be not worthy thereof be worthy of more sir for if sinned like woman died like saint yes sir answered old man with proud smile have right english blood in doubt not showed at last now sir more of when need ship mine be at service till then sir farewell god be with old man rose with unmoved countenance bowed amyas to door amyas went back told cary bidding take half of salterne gift cary swore great oath that must have none of heir of clovelly amyas want to rob who have lost nothing who have lost brother god forbid must ever touch farthing beyond original share that evening messenger from bideford came running breathless up to burrough court authority wanted amyas immediate attendance for be one of last seemed who have seen mr salterne alive salterne have gone over a soon a amyas departed to old acquaintance signed sealed will in presence with firm cheerful countenance refusing condolence then gone home locked into rose room supper time came did not appear apprentice must not make answer at last called in neighbor forced door salterne be kneeling by daughter bed head be upon coverlet prayer book be open before at burial service hand be clasped in supplication be dead cold will lay by have left property among poor relation saving excepting money etc due to a owner part adventurer of ship rose new bark of three hundred ton burden now lying east water be bequeathed to captain amyas leigh on condition that must re christen bark vengeance fit out with part of treasure with sail once more against spaniard before three year be past be end of william salterne merchant chapter xxix how virginia fleet be stopped by queen command daughter of debate that discord still doth sow will reap gain where former rule hath taught still peace to grow foreign banish 'd wight will anker in port realm brook stranger force let elsewhere resort qu elizabeth now amyas be settled quietly at home again for next twelve month little pass worthy of record in page yeo have installed a major domo with very definite function save of walking about everywhere at amyas heel like lank gray wolf hound spending evening at fireside a true old sailor doe with bible on knee hand busy in manufacturing numberless nicknack useful useless for member of family above for ayacanora whom insult week by humbly offering toy only fit for child at pout be reproved by mr leigh then take gift put away never to look at again for whole soul be set upon being english maid run about day long after mr leigh insisting upon learning mystery of kitchen still room above art of making clothes for herself at last for everybody in northam for first will be good housewife like mr leigh next new idea have dawned on that of helping others to boundless hospitality of savage have be of course accustomed to give to who can give nothing in return be new thought see mr leigh spending spare hour in working for poor visiting in cottage see amyas after public thanks in church for safe return giving away money food what not in appledore bideford buying cottage making almshouses for worn out mariner be told that be thank offering to god be puzzled notion of thank offering be rather that of indian indeed of spaniard sacrifice of human victim bedizenment of great spirit sanctuary with skull bone not that amyas a plain old fashioned churchman be unmindful of good old instinctive rule that something must be given to church for vicar of northam be soon resplendent with new surplice what be more altar with splendid flagon salver of plate lost suppose in civil war have be taken in great galleon ayacanora must understand almsgiving must not till mr leigh told in simple way that gave to poor gave to great spirit for great spirit be in in ayacanora too if must be quiet listen to instead of pouting stamping doing nothing what liked poor child took in new thought like child worked finger to bone for old dame in northam went about with mr leigh lovely beloved looked now then out from under long black eyelash to see if be winning smile from amyas on day on won one be good day on day on did not be thoroughly naughty must have worn out patience of soul le chastened than mr leigh a for pomp glory of dress there be keeping within bound swept into church sunday bedizened in spanish finery with blaze rustle that good vicar have to remonstrate humbly with mr leigh on disturbance caused to eye thought of congregation to ayacanora answered that be not thinking about need not think about that if piache in plain english conjuror a supposed wanted present might have mexican feather dress must not wear be wild indian thing be english maid must just do for piache so darted upstairs brought down insisted so stoutly on arraying vicar therein that good man beat swift retreat carried off with nevertheless one of handsomest mantle instead of selling converted cleverly enough into altar cloth for several year afterwards communion at northam be celebrated upon blaze of emerald azure crimson have once adorned sinful body of aztec prince so ayacanora flaunted on while amyas watched half amused half in simple pride of beauty looked around at gazers a much a to say see what fine bird have brought home great trouble gave mr leigh be conduct to lady of neighborhood came of course one not only to congratulate mr leigh to get peep at fair savage fair savage snubbed round from vicar wife to lady grenville so effectually that few attempted second visit mr leigh remonstrated be answered by flood of tear only come to stare at poor wild indian girl must not be made show of be like queen once one obeyed here one looked down upon when mr leigh asked whether must sooner go back to forest poor girl clung to like baby entreated not to be sent away must sooner be slave in kitchen here than go back to bad people so on month after month of foolish storm foolish sunshine be under shadow of one in whom be storm sunshine perpetual genial calm of soft gray weather tempered down to own peacefulness who entered charmed influence outburst grew more more rare ayacanora more more rational though more happy day by day one by one small hint came out made identity certain at least in eye of mr leigh yeo after have become familiar with sight of house gave to understand that have seen such thing before red cattle too seemed not unknown to sheep puzzled for time at last gave mr leigh to understand that be too small ah madam quoth yeo who caught at straw be because have be accustomed to great camel sheep llama call in peru ayacanora delight be horse use of tame animal at be daily wonder to that horse must be ridden be crowning miracle of horse must ride after plaguing amyas for one in vain for did not want to break pretty neck proposed confidentially to yeo to steal one foiled in went to vicar offered to barter finery for broken kneed pony vicar be too honest to drive so good bargain matter ended in amyas buying jennet learned in fortnight to ride like very gaucho now awoke curious slumbering reminiscence for one day at lady grenville invitation whole family went over to stow mr leigh soberly on pillion behind groom ayacanora cantering round round upon moor like hound let loose trying to make amyas ride race with that night sleeping in same room with mr leigh awoke shrieking sobbed out long story how old ape of panama especial abomination have come to bedside dragged forth into courtyard how have mounted horse ridden with indian over great moor high mountain down into dark wood there indian horse vanished found suddenly changed once more into little savage child so strong be impression that must not be persuaded that thing have not happened if not that night at least night other so mr leigh at last believed same told company next morning in pious way how lord have revealed in vision to poor child who be how have be exposed in forest by jealous step father sir richard wife must doubt that hers be true solution be probable that don xararte though home be panama have be often at quito for yeo have seen come on board lima ship at guayaquil one of nearest port must explain having be found by indian beyond cotopaxi nearest peak of eastern andes if a be too likely old man believing to be child have conceived fearful vengeance of exposing in forest other little fact came to light one by one be all connected a be natural in savage with animal other natural object impression moral affection have received have be erased by long spiritual death of forest sojourn mr leigh must not elicit from trace of feeling about mother recollection of early religious teaching link however be supplied at last in way sir richard have brought home indian with from virginia of original name be not sure be probably wanchese whose name occurs with of manteo man be to be baptized in church at bideford by name of raleigh sponsor being most probably raleigh who may have be there on virginian business sir richard grenville notability of bideford came of course to see baptism of first red man whose foot have ever trodden british soil mayor corporation men appeared in full robe with mace tipstaff to do honor to first fruit of gospel in west mr leigh went a matter of course ayacanora must need go too be very anxious to know what be going to do with carib to make christian why did not make one because be one already be sure that have be christened a soon a be born be not sure pouted good deal at chance of ugly red carib being better off than be however assembled duly stately son of forest now transformed into footman of sir richard be standing at font service be half performed when heavy sigh rather groan made eye turn ayacanora sank fainting upon mr leigh bosom be carried out to neighboring house when came to herself told strange story how a be standing there trying to recollect whether too have ever be baptized church seemed to grow larger priest dress richer wall be covered with picture above altar in jewelled robe stood lady in arm babe soft music sounded in ear air be full on insisted much of fragrant odor filled church like mist through saw not one many indian standing by font lady held by hand be little girl again after many questioning so accurate be recollection not only of scene of building yeo pronounced christened woman be madam if popish christening be worth calling such have seen indian christened too in cathedral church at inside whereof know well enough too well for sat there three mortal hour in san benito to hear friar preach false doctrine not knowing whether be to be burnt not next day so ayacanora went home to burrough raleigh indian to sir richard house entry of baptism still stand crooked lettered in old parchment register of bideford baptism for raleigh winganditoian march name occurs once more year month after rawly winganditoian april be not time among baptism free forest wanderer have pined in vain for old deer hunt amid fragrant cedar wood lazy paddlings through still lagoon where water lily sleep beneath shade of great magnolia wreathed with clustered vine now be away to happier hunting ground be left of below sleep in narrow town churchyard blocked in with dingy house whose tenant will never waste sigh upon indian grave there two entry stand unto day most pathetic have seemed to sort of emblem first fruit of sad fate of worn out red race to whom civilization came too late to save not too late to hasten decay though amyas lay idle england did not that spring saw larger colony sent out by raleigh to virginia under charge of one john white raleigh have written more than once entreating amyas to take command if have done perhaps united state have begun to exist twenty year sooner than actually did mother have bound by solemn promise who can wonder at for asking at for giving to wait at home with twelve month at least so instead of sent five hundred pound suppose be in virginia virtually at least until day for never came back again to soon came sharper trial of amyas promise to mother one made for first time in life moody peevish restless at thought that others be fighting spaniard while be sitting idle at home for whole soul be filling fast with sullen malice against don guzman be losing single eye whole body be no longer full of light have entered into darkness in man walk who hate brother lay upon like black shadow day night company too must be more fit to darken shadow than salvation yeo old man grew more stern in fanaticism day by day found too willing listener in master mr leigh be perhaps for first last time in life seriously angry when heard two coolly debating whether have not committed grievous sin in not killing spanish prisoner on board galleon must be said however a plain fact set down in book testify that if such be temper of englishman at day spaniard have done good deal to provoke be just then attempting to do still more for now be approaching year astronomer of konigsberg above hundred year before foretold must be admirable year german chronologers presaged must be climacterical year of world prophecy may stand for what be worth be at least fulfilled year be indeed climacterical year of world decided once for fortune of european nation of whole continent of america wonder then if a have happened in great crisis of human race awful instinct that day of lord be at hand dim feeling that there be war in heaven that fiend of darkness angel of light be arrayed against other in mighty struggle for possession of soul of men must have tried to express in astrologic dream a be fashion then attributed to ruler of planetary house sympathy with coming world tragedy for wise there needed conjunction of planet to tell that day be near at hand when long desultory duel between spain england must end once for in great death grapple war a yet have be confined to netherlands to west indie coast isle of africa to quarter in fact where spain be held either to have right to have forfeited by tyranny spain have be respected by england a england have by spain trade to spanish port went on a usual till in year spaniard without warning laid embargo on english ship coming to european shore be to be seized seemed to form part of enormous armament be to attack crush once for whom rebellious netherlander said spaniard queen ministry when be just not too late people of england thought otherwise england be destined victim so instead of negotiating in order to avoid fighting fought in order to produce negotiation drake frobisher carlisle a have seen swept spanish main with fire sword stopping indian supply while walsingham craftiest yet most honest of mortal prevented by mysterious financial operation venetian merchant from repairing spaniard loss by loan armada came that year in meanwhile jesuit here abroad made secret among own dupe of real object of spanish armament impious heretic drake raleigh grenvilles cavendish hawkins frobisher who have dared to violate hidden sanctuary of just globe pope have bestowed on defender of true faith shameful ruin terrible death awaited when sacrilegious bark must sink beneath thunder of spanish cannon blessed by pope sanctified with holy water prayer to service of god mother yes must fall england with proud islander who have dared to rebel against st peter to cast off worship of mary must bow neck once more under yoke of gospel so called queen illegitimate excommunicate contumacious abettor of free trade defender of netherlands pillar of false doctrine throughout europe must be sent in chain across alp to sue for life at foot of injured long suffering father of mankind while nominee took place upon throne have long since forfeited by heresy what nobler work how must church of god be more gloriously propagated how must higher merit be obtained by faithful catholic must succeed spain be invincible in valor inexhaustible in wealth heaven offered opportunity have nothing now to fear from turk for have concluded truce with nothing from french for be embroiled in civil war heaven have called upon spain to fulfil heavenly mission restore to church crown brightest richest of lost jewel heaven called to new crusade saint whose altar english have rifled profaned called to new crusade virgin queen of heaven whose boundless store of grace english spurned called to new crusade justly incensed at own wrong indignity 'ever gracious virgin refuge of sinner mother of fair love holy hope adjured by knightly honor valiant cavalier to do battle in cause against impious harlot who assumed title received from idolatrous flatterer homage due to mary alone even for father parson have asserted therefore must be true have caused name to be substituted for of mary in litany of church let who wore within manly heart without manly sword look on woe of beary shame tear blush heart pierced through with daily wound from heretic tongue choose between elizabeth so said parson allen dozen more said more than too much one have rather not repeat be somewhat surprised mortified to find hearer though granted premise be too dull carnal to arrive at same conclusion english lay romanists almost to man have heart sounder than head howsoever illogically must not help holding to strange superstition that being englishman be bound to fight for england so hapless jesuit who have be boasting for year past that persecuted faithful throughout island must rise a one man to fight under blessed banner of pope spain found that faithful like demas of old forsook went after present world having objection of course to restoration of popery preferring more comfortable method than invasion must inevitably rob of ancestral land must seat needy greedy castilian in old country house to treat tenant a have treated indian of hispaniola a have treated cacique though heart of men in ungodly age be too hard to melt at supposed woe of mary who reigned above too dull to turn rebel traitor for sake of throne principality in supra lunar sphere might be in gift yet there be mary who reigned ought to reign below whose woe like gift be somewhat more palpable to carnal sense mary who having comfort luxury including hound horse found for by english government at expense must be now equal to twenty thousand year must afford to employ whole of jointure a queen dowager of france probably equal to fifty thousand year more in plotting destruction of said government murder of queen mary who if prospered a ought might have dukedom earldom fair land castle to bestow on faithful servant mary finally who contrived by mean of angel face serpent tongue heart a said a hard a diamond to make weak man fall in love with what be worse fancy more le that be in love with of jesuit be not unmindful found convenient indeed to forget awhile sorrow of queen of heaven in of queen of scot not that cared much for sorrow be excellent stock in trade be romanist be beautiful unfortunate virtue like charity hide multitude of sin therefore be convenient card to play in great game of rome against queen people of england played poor card be till got torn up by over using into merit demerit enter deeply here let rest in peace to people of england made most practical terrible answer from highest noble to lowest peasant arose one simultaneous plebiscitum be tired of seventeen year of chicanery terror woman must die commonweal of england perish know of two alternative be chosen europe stood aghast rather with astonishment at english audacity than with horror at english wickedness mary own french kinsfolk have openly given up a too bad to be excused much le assisted own son blustered little to english ambassador for majesty of king be invaded whereon walsingham said in open council that queen must send couple of hound must set right sage advice being acted on deer sent over above be so successful that pious mourner having run off randolph say like baby to see deer in cart returned for answer that must thereafter depend wholly upon majesty serve fortune against world that only wanted now two of majesty yeoman pricker couple of groom of deer spaniard be not sorry on whole for catastrophe for have kept from conquering england long ago be fear lest after be done might have have to put crown thereof on mary head instead of own mary death be a convenient stalking horse to a to pope now armada be coming in earnest elizabeth began negotiating fancy not that doe nothing more a following letter testifies written about midsummer f drake to captain amyas leigh with haste dear lad a said to most glorious majesty say to now there be two way of facing enemy one to stand off cry 'try again will strike thee ' other to strike first then 'try at will strike thee again ' of latter counsel majesty so far approves that go forthwith tell not in gath down coast to singe king of spain beard so termed to majesty laughing in if leave so much a fishing boat afloat from groyne unto cadiz will not be with good will who intend that if come year will come by swimming not by sailing so if be still man have known bring good ship round to plymouth within month away with for hard blow hard money feel of of know pretty well by now thine lovingly f drake amyas clutched lock over letter smoked more tobacco day got than have ever before be consumed at once in england kept true to promise be reply amyas leigh to worshipful sir f drake admiral of majesty fleet in plymouth most honored sir magician keep here in bilboes for have picklock namely mother who forbids loss be mine antichrist can fight year for will not die bout next while mother will not trouble patience more than to ask from to get news if can from prisoner of one don guzman maria magdalena sotomayor de soto whether be in spain in indie what villain doe where be to be found only entreat of so remain behind with heavy heart yours to command in else must to heaven in also amyas returned triumphant having destroyed hundred sail in cadiz alone taken three great galleon with immense wealth on board burnt small craft all along shore offered battle to santa cruz at mouth of tagus after be unnecessary to say that armada be put off for yet year news indeed gave amyas little comfort for merely observed grumbling that drake have gone spoiled everybody else sport what cheered be terrible joy took possession of when armada came a come must must meet enemy at last must wait now patiently if shuddered at a found in very act of breathing prayer don guzman might not die before good englishman to carry out by rebelling against elizabeth bull of sixtus fifth said blush to repeat to have be dictated by holy ghost of inquisitor getting ready fetter devil engine of sort of than by tormenting one whom love because love tut play mother maid temper how can break heart what have done have not given up going again to west indie for sake have not given up going to virginia much for mother measure one else tenderness by own think that owes somewhat silly boy be not gratitude deeper affection may be more heavenly than gratitude a may too become horrible cause of ruin rest with amyas of two will be be in earnest have heart time to jest of course not mother thought be not comely for woman to fall in love with men not comely at least to confess love to men have never done amyas not even by look tone of voice though have watched for month to be sure be a demure a cat when be in way only wonder how found out ah said smiling sadly even in saddest woman soul there linger before beside churchyard wall not alone time for ayacanora stood by side gazed gazed till eye seemed ready to burst from socket at last turned away with sob never bade good bye mother god forgive come triumph a on raree show to feed silly wonder use enjoy without thankfulness understanding a ox eats clover thrust into rack without knowing caring how grew if of be of class by whom very triumph have be achieved thinker worker who instead of entering lazily into other men labor a mob doe labor who know by hard experience struggle self restraint disappointment slow staggering step by discoverer reach to prize then smile of men must not have be one of pity rather of filial love for must have seen in outwardly paltry armament potential germ of mightier one now load black sea wave must have be aware that to produce with such material knowledge a then existed demanded intellect energy spirit of progress invention equal if not superior to of now so loudly boast if again have be student of men rather than of machinery must have found few nobler company on whom to exercise discernment than might have seen in little terrace bowling green behind pelican inn on afternoon of nineteenth of july appointed for half of europe whole of future america be twelve day epic worthy a said in beginning of book not of dull prose of thunder roll of homer verse having to tell must do best rather using where can word of contemporary author than own lord high admirall of england sending pinnace before called defiance denounced war by discharging ordnance presently approaching with in musquet shot with much thundering out of own ship called arkroyall alias triumph first set upon admirall a thought of spaniard be alfonso de leon ship soon after drake hawkins frobisher played stoutly with ordnance on hindmost squadron be commanded by recalde spaniard soon discover superior nimbleness of english ship recalde squadron finding that be getting more than give in spite of endeavor hurry forward to join rest of fleet medina admiral finding ship scattering fast gather into half moon armada try to keep solemn way forward like stately herd of buffalo who march on across prairie disdaining to notice wolf snarl around track in vain be wolf cunning hunter swiftly horsed keenly armed who will shamefully shuffle to use drake own expression that vast herd from lizard to portland from portland to calais road who even in short two hour fight have made many spaniard question boasted invincibleness of armada one of four great gallia be already riddled with shot to great disarrangement of pulpit chapel friar therein assistant fleet have to close round drake hawkins will sink in effecting manoeuvre principal galleon of seville in be pedro de valdez host of blue blooded don run foul of neighbor carry away foremast be in spite of spanish chivalry left to fate doe not look like victory certainly courage though valdez be left behind lady saint bull caena domini dictated by one whom dare not name here be with still be blasphemous to doubt in meanwhile if have fared better than against third of plymouth fleet how will fare when forty belated ship be already whitening blue between mewstone enter scene to play part so end first day not english ship hardly man be hurt have destroyed for ever in english mind prestige of boastful spain have justified utterly policy good lord howard have adopted by raleigh drake advice of keeping up running fight instead of clapping ship together without consideration in case say raleigh have be lost if have not be better advised than great many malignant fool be who found fault with demeanor be that a may so end first day in amyas other bideford ship have be right busy for two hour knocking hole in huge galleon carry on poop maiden with wheel bear name of sta catharina have coat of arm on flag at sprit probably of commandant of soldier be shot away early in fight so amyas can not tell whether be de soto not nevertheless there be plenty of time for private revenge amyas called off at last by admiral signal go to bed sleep soundly ere have be in hammock hour be awakened by cary coming down to ask for order be to follow drake lantern amyas where be ca see unless have be taken up aloft there among star for new drakium sidus amyas turn out grumbling lantern be to be seen only sudden explosion great fire on board spaniard be gradually got under while have to lie to whole night long with nearly whole fleet next morning find off torbay amyas be hailed by pinnace bringing letter from drake saving spelling be somewhat arbitrary like most men in day ran somewhat thus dear lad have be wool gathering night after five great hulk pixy transfigured overnight into galleon morning again into german merchantman let go with blessing coming back fell in god be thanked with valdez great galleon in good booty don fellow have left behind like faithful valiant comrade lord howard have let slip past thinking deserted by crew have sent to dartmouth sight of nobleman gentleman maybe half hundred valdez who when sent pinnace aboard must need stand on punctilio propound condition answered have time to tell with if must need die then be very man for if must live then buena querra sends again boasting that be don pedro valdez that stood not with honor that of don in company replied that for part be francis drake match burning whereon find in name salve for wound of own come aboard kissing fist with spanish lie of holding fortunate that have fallen into hand of fortunate drake much more might have kept to cool porridge have much news from for be leaky tub among others that don guzman be aboard of sta catharina commandant of soldiery have arm flying at sprit beside sta catharina at poop be maiden with wheel be lofty built ship of tier of ordnance from god preserve send like luck with deare friend admirall f drake sail in squadron of recalde armada be minded to smoke out of plymouth god grace be tried not order from home be too strait so slave fight like bull in tether no farther than rope finding thus devil hard master a do most in end can not compass quick handling tacking take for very witch so far so good better to come know length of foot of old time light will kill hare will find long way from start to dunkirk admiral be in gracious humor leigh to have vouchsafed so long letter st catherine why be galleon hammered yesterday said amyas stamping on deck of course be well will find again doubt not that cunning old drake how have contrived to line own pocket even though have to keep whole fleet waiting for have given lord high admiral dor at event lord howard be too high hearted to stop plunder papist though be amyas amyas answered by growl for worshipped drake be not too just to papist fleet did not find lord howard till lord sheffield have be holding on steadfastly whole night after spanish lantern with two ship only at least there be doubt now of loyalty of english roman catholic indeed throughout fight howard showed a if to wipe out slur have be cast on loyalty by fanatic desperate courage might have thrust prudent men into destruction led only to victory soon large spaniard drift by deserted partly burnt of men be for leaving place to board amyas stoutly refuse have come out to fight not to plunder so let nearest ship to have luck without grudging pas on men pull long face when see galleon snapped up by next neighbor towed off to weymouth where prof to be ship of miguel d'oquenda vice admiral saw last night blown up by desperate netherland gunner who being misused be minded to pay off old score on tyrant so end second day while portland rise higher clearer hour next morning find off island will try portsmouth though have spared plymouth wind have shifted to north blow clear cool off white walled down of weymouth bay spaniard turn face english must mean to stand off on until wind will change then to try for needle at least will have work to do before round purbeck isle english go to westward again be only to return on opposite tack now begin series of manoeuvre fleet trying to get wind of other struggle doe not last long ere noon english fleet have slipped close hauled between armada land be coming down upon right before wind now begin fight most fierce fell fight did confusedly with variable fortune while on one hand english manfully rescued ship of london be hemmed in by spaniard on other side spaniard a stoutly delivered recalde being in danger never be heard such thundering of ordnance on side notwithstanding from spaniard flew for most part over english without harm only cock englishman whom prince claim hope rightfully a worthy of devon died with honor in midst of enemy in small ship of for english ship being far lesser charged enemy with marvellous agility having discharged broadside flew forth presently into deep levelled shot directly without missing at great unwieldy spanish ship be most furious bloody skirmish of though ending only seems in capture of great venetian small craft in lord admiral fighting amidst enemy fleet seeing one of captain afar off fenner by name who fought seven portugal at azores cried o george what doest thou wilt thou now frustrate hope opinion conceived of thee wilt thou forsake now ' with word being enflamed approached did part of most valiant captain a indeed did rest night fall upon floating volcano morning find far past purbeck with white peak of freshwater ahead pouring out past needle ship after ship to join gallant chase for now from haven in vessel fitted out at own expense flock chivalry of england lord oxford northumberland cumberland pallavicin brooke carew raleigh blunt many honorable name a to set field where immortal fame honor be to be attained spain have staked chivalry in mighty cast not noble house of arragon castile have lent brother son will mourn loss of one england gentleman will measure strength once for against cavalier of spain lord howard have sent forward light craft into portsmouth for ammunition will scarce return to night for wind fall dead evening two fleet drift helpless with tide shout idle defiance at other with trumpet fife drum sun go down upon glassy sea rise on glassy sea again what day be twenty fifth st james day sacred to patron saint of spain will nothing be attempted in honor by whose forefather have so often seen with bodily eye charging in van upon snow white steed scattering paynim with celestial lance might have sent certainly favoring breeze perhaps only mean to try faith at least galley will attack in van three of great gallia fourth lie half crippled among fleet thrash sea to foam with three hundred oar apiece see not st james leading to victory lord howard triumph brother lion southwell elizabeth jonas lord sheffield bear barker victory george fenner leicester towed stoutly out to meet with such salvo of chain shot smashing oar cutting rigging have not wind sprung up again toward noon spanish fleet come up to rescue have shared fate of valdez biscayan now fight becomes general frobisher beat down spanish admiral mainmast attacked by mexia recalde be rescued by lord howard who endangered in turn be rescued in turn while after day so sickened be of english gunnery galliasse must adventure to fight so with variable fortune fight thunder on livelong afternoon beneath virgin cliff of freshwater while myriad sea fowl rise screaming up from ledge spot with black wing snow white wall of chalk lone shepherd hurry down slope above to peer over dizzy edge forgets wheatear fluttering in snare while gaze trembling upon glimpse of tall mast gorgeous flag piercing at time league broad veil of sulphur smoke welter far below so fare st james day a baal did on carmel in old time be talking be pursuing be on journey peradventure sleepeth must be awaked at least only fire by have answered votary have be that of english cannon armada gathering into roundel will fight no more make best of way to calais where perhaps guise faction may have french force ready to assist then to dunkirk to join with parma great flotilla of netherlands so on before fair etesian gale follows clear bright out of south southwest glide forward two great fleet past brighton cliff beachy head hastings dungeness be battle triumph for by sea lord howard instead of fighting be rewarding after lord thomas howard lord sheffield townsend frobisher have received at hand that knighthood be then more honorable than peerage old admiral hawkins kneel rise up sir john shaking shoulder after accolade observes to representative of majesty that old woman will hardly know again when folk call lady meanwhile cliff be lined with pike men musketeer by countryman groom who can bear arm led by squire sheriff marching eastward a fast a weapon let towards dover shore not with alone from many mile inland come down woman child aged folk in wagon to join feeble shout prayer be not feeble to great cry of mingled faith fear ascends to throne of god from spectator of britain salami let pray on danger be not over yet though lord howard have have news from newhaven that guise will not stir against england seymour winter have left post of observation on flemish shore to make up number of fleet to hundred forty sail larger slightly than of spanish fleet of not more than tonnage one third number of men spaniard be dispirited battered unbroken still a slide to anchorage in calais road on saturday evening of most memorable week prudent men know well that england hour be come that bell will call christendom to church upon morrow morn will be death knell triumphal peal of reformed faith throughout world solemn day that sabbath must have be in country in town many light hearted coward doubtless who have scoffed a many did at notion of armada coming because dare not face thought gave up to abject fear a now plainly saw heard that of before must not be persuaded many brave man too a knelt beside wife daughter felt heart sink to very pavement at thought of what beloved one might be enduring few short day hence from profligate fanatical soldiery from more deliberate fiendishness of inquisition massacre of st bartholomew fire of smithfield immolation of moor extermination of west indian fantastic horror of piedmontese persecution make unreadable too truthful page of morland be spectre not a now dim distant through mist of century recent bleeding from still gaping wound flitted before eye of englishman filled brain heart with fire knew full well fate in store for one false step unspeakable doom not two generation afterwards befell lutheran of magdeburg must have befallen town from london to carlisle knew hazard a prayed day many day before after throughout england netherlands none knew better than who be guiding spirit of devoted land especial mark of invader fury who by divine inspiration a men then not unwisely held devised daring stroke be to anticipate coming blow where be amyas leigh while day after day have be seeking sta catharina in thickest of press can not come at can not even hear of one moment dread that have sunk by night balked of prey next that have repaired damage will escape after be moody discontented restless even for first time in life peevish with men can talk of nothing don guzman can find better employment at spare moment than taking sword out of sheath handling fondling talking to even bidding not to fail in day of vengeance at last have sent to squire armorer for whetstone half ashamed of own folly whets polish in bye corner muttering to that one fixed thought of selfish vengeance have possessed whole mind forgets england present need past triumph own safety everything brother blood yet be day for have be longing ever since brought home that magic horn a fifteen year boy day when must find face to face with invader that invader antichrist have believed for year with drake hawkins grenville raleigh that be called sent into world only to fight spaniard be fighting now in such cause for stake within such battle list a will never see again yet be not content while throughout gallant fleet whole crew be receiving communion side by side rising with cheerful face to shake hand to rejoice that be sharer in britain salami amyas turn away from holy element can not communicate sir john charity with men hate if ever man hated on earth hate lord foe only captain leigh jack hate own a well one in fleet sir try to put off with same jesuit quibble false knave parson fletcher invented for one of doughty men to drug conscience withal when be plotting against own admiral jack hate one of whom know somehow that hatred of keep from loving human being be in love charity with man sir john brimblecombe not even with go way in god name sir leave devil alone together will find word be true jack departed with sigh while crew be receiving communion on deck amyas sate below in cabin sharpening sword after called for boat went on board drake ship to ask news of sta catharina listened scowling to loud chant tinkling bell came across water from spanish fleet at last drake be summoned by lord admiral returned with secret commission ought to bear fruit night amyas who have gone with helped till then returned to own ship a sir amyas leigh knight to joy glory of soul on board except moody so there livelong summer sabbath day before little high walled town long range of yellow sandhills lie two mighty armament scowling at other hardly out of gunshot messenger after messenger be hurrying towards bruges to duke of parma for light craft can follow nimble english somewhat better than own floating castle above entreating to put to sea at once with force duke be not with force at dunkirk on future field of waterloo paying devotion to st mary of halle in hainault in order to make sure in pantheon already see in vision of night gentle souled pure lipped saint cardinal allen placing crown of england on head return for answer first that victual be not ready next that dutch sailor who have be kept at post for many week at sword point have run away like water thirdly that over above can not come so strangely provided of great ordnance musketeer be five thirty dutch ship in round sterned stubborn hearted heretic watch like terrier at rat hole entrance of nieuwport dunkirk having ensured private patronage of st mary of halle will return to morrow to make experience of effect only hear across flat of dixmude thunder of fleet at dunkirk open curse of officer for while have be praying nothing more english have be praying something more be left for prince of parma be to hang few purveyor a peace offering to sulking army then chafe a drake say of like bear robbed of whelp for lord henry seymour have brought lord howard letter of command from elizabeth self drake have be carrying out so busily sunday long that by two o'clock on monday morning eight fire ship besmeared with wild fire brimstone pitch resin ordnance charged with bullet with stone be stealing down wind straight for spanish fleet guided by two valiant men of devon young prowse let name live long in land ship be fired men of devon steal back in moment more heaven be red with glare from dover cliff to gravelines tower weary hearted belgian boor far away inland plundered dragooned for many hideous year leap from bed fancy not so far wrongly that day of judgment be come at last to end woe hurl down vengeance on tyrant then break forth one of disgraceful panic so often follow overweening presumption shriek oath prayer reproach make night hideous there be too on board who recollect well enough jenebelli fire ship at antwerp three year before wreck made of parma bridge across scheldt if must be like cutting cable hoisting sail invincible armada go lumbering wildly out to sea ship foul of neighbor largest of four gallia loses rudder drift helpless to fro hindering confusing duke having so spaniard say weighed anchor deliberately instead of leaving behind run in again after awhile fire signal for return truant sheep be deaf to shepherd pipe swearing praying by turn run up channel towards gravelines picking up straggler on way who be struggling a best can among flat willow drake fenner have arrived a soon a when monday sun rise on quaint old castle muddy dyke of gravelines town thunder of cannon recommences be not hushed till night drake can hang coolly enough in rear to plunder when think fit when battle need none can fight more fiercely among foremost there be need now if ever that armada must never be allowed to re form if doe left wing may yet keep english at bay while right drive off blockading hollander from dunkirk port set parma flotilla free to join to sail in doubled strength across to mouth of thames so drake have weighed anchor away up channel with squadron moment that saw spanish fleet come up with fenner burning to redeem honor indeed have never lost ere fenton beeston crosse ryman lord southwell can join devon ship have be worrying spaniard for two full hour into confusion worse confounded what be heavy firing behind ala for great galliasse lie like huge stranded whale upon sand where now stand calais pier amyas preston future hero of la guayra be pounding into submission while fleet of hoy drumblers look on help a jackal might lion soon on south west horizon loom up larger larger two mighty ship behind sail on sail a near shout greets triumph bear on in lord high admiral glide stately into thickest of fight true have still three twenty ship can cope at with ninety of spaniard have dash daring inspiration of utter need now never must mighty struggle be ended worried off portland must rend in piece now in rush ship after ship to smash broadside through through wooden castle sometimes not pike length asunder then out again to re load give place meanwhile to smaller be fighting with sail set few larger who once in be careless about coming out again fight with top sail loose main foreyards close down on deck to prevent being boarded duke oquenda recalde having with much ado got clear of willow bear brunt of fight to seaward in vain day go against more more a run on seymour winter have battered great san philip into wreck mast be gone by board pimentelli in san matthew come up to take mastiff off fainting bull find fasten on winter bow pours broadside into of san matthew then glide on to re load not to return for not pistol shot to leeward worried by three four small craft lie immense galleon on poop can believe eye for suppressed voice not shot re load be ready must speak with first silent a grave amid infernal din vengeance glide up to spaniard quarter don guzman maria magdalena sotomayor de soto shout amyas from mizzen rigging loud clear amid roar have not called in vain fearless graceful a ever tall mail clad figure of foe leap up upon poop railing twenty foot above amyas head shout through vizor at service sir whosoever may be dozen musket arrow be levelled at amyas frown down man strike spare if kill other soul on board don guzman be captain sir amyas leigh proclaim traitor ravisher challenge once more to single combat when where will be welcome to come on board sir answer spaniard in clear quiet tone bringing with answer that lie in throat lingering moment out of bravado to arrange scarf step slowly down again behind bulwark coward shout amyas at top of voice spaniard re appears instantly why name senor of others asks in cool stern voice because call men coward in england who leave wife to be burnt alive by priest moment word have passed amyas lip felt that be cruel unjust be too late to recall spaniard started clutched sword hilt then hissed back through closed vizor for word sirrah hang at yardarm if saint mary give grace see that halter be silken one then laughed amyas for be just dubbed knight stepped down a storm of bullet rang through rigging round head spaniard be not a punctilious a fire ordnance crash through stern work of spaniard then sail onward while ball go humming harmlessly through rigging hour have passed of wild noise fury three time have vengeance a dolphin might sailed clean round round sta catharina pouring in broadside after broadside till gun be leaping to deck beam with own heat spaniard side be slit spotted in hundred place yet so high have be fire in return so strong deck defence of vengeance that few spar broken two three men wounded by musketry be loss still spaniard endures magnificent a ever be battle of thresher whale end be certain work be long can help captain leigh asked lord henry seymour a pass within be length of to attack ship ahead san matthew have have dinner be gone on to medina to ask for digestive to thank lordship be private quarrel of spoke if lordship must lend powder must must so fear say other gentleman in fleet puff of wind clear away sulphurous veil for moment sea be clear of ship towards land spanish fleet be moving again up channel medina bringing up rear only two mile to right hand vast hull of san philip be drifting up shore with tide somewhat nearer san matthew be hard at work at pump can see white stream of water pouring down side go in lord have pair shout amyas sir forward be seymour cry will leave to pay flushingers expense on went lord henry on shore went san philip at ostend to be plundered by flushingers while san matthew whose captain on hault courage have refused to save gentleman on board medina ship went blundering miserably into hungry mouth of captain peter vanderduess four other valiant dutchman who like prudent men of holland contrived to keep galleon afloat till have emptied then hung up banner in great church of leyden being of length that being fastened to roof reached unto very ground in meanwhile long ere sun have set come down darkness of thunderstorm attracted a to volcano mouth to vast mass of sulphur smoke cloak sea for many mile heaven artillery above make answer to man below still through smoke rain amyas cling to prey too have seen northward movement of spanish fleet set topsail amyas call to men to fire high cripple rigging in vain for three four belated galley having forced way at last over willow come flashing sputtering up to combatant take fire off galleon amyas grind teeth must fain hustle into thick of press once more in spite of galley beak most heroical captain say cary pulling long face if do be stove sunk in five minute not to mention that yeo say have not twenty round of great cartridge left so surely silent vengeance sheers off keep a near a can to little squadron through night of rain thunder follows next morning sun rise on clear sky with strong west north west breeze heart be asking what day will bring forth be long past dunkirk now german ocean be opening before spaniard sorely battered lessened in number have during night regained sort of order english hang on skirt mile two behind have ammunition must wait for more to amyas great disgust sta catharina have rejoined fellow during night never mind say cary can neither dive fly a long a be above water be admiral about be signalling lord henry seymour squadron soon tack come down wind for coast of flanders parma must be blockaded still hollander be likely to be too busy with plunder to do effectually suddenly there be stir in spanish fleet medina rearmost ship turn upon english what can mean will offer battle once more if so be best to get out of way for have nothing wherewith to fight so english lie close to wind will let pas return to old tactic of following harassing good bye to seymour say cary if be caught between parma flotilla be going to dunkirk impossible will not have water enough to reach light craft here come big ship right upon give have left lad if will fight lay alongside die boarding gave what have hulled with shot huge side stood silent a grave have not wherewithal to return compliment a live be cutting loose foot of mainsail villain mean to run there go rest of victoria shouted cary a one after spaniard set sail must there be silence for few minute throughout english fleet then cheer upon cheer of triumph rent sky be over spaniard have refused battle thinking only of safety be pressing downward toward strait again invincible armada have cast away name england be saved will never get there sir said old yeo who have come upon deck to murmur nunc domine gaze upon sight beyond human faith hope never never will weather flanders shore against breeze a be coming up look to eye of wind sir see how lord be fighting for people yes down came fresher stiffer minute out of gray north west a doe so often after thunder storm sea began to rise high white under claro aquilone till spaniard be fain to take in spare canvas lie to a best must while english fleet lying to also awaited event be in god hand not in theirs will be ashore on zealand before afternoon murmured amyas have lost labor oh for powder powder powder to go in finish at once oh sir said yeo murmur against lord in very day of mercy be hard to be sure will be done must not borrow powder from drake there look at sea sir indeed sea be far too rough for such attempt spaniard neared neared fatal dune fringed shore for many dreary mile amyas have to wait weary hour growling like dog who have have bone snatched out of mouth till day wore on when behold wind began to fall a rapidly a have risen savage joy rose in amyas heart be safe safe for who will go beg powder cartridge here cartridge there anything to set to work again cary volunteered returned in couple of hour with quantity be on board again only just in time for south wester have recovered mastery of sky spaniard english be moving away time northward whither now to scotland amyas knew not cared not provided be in company of don guzman de soto armada be defeated england saved such great undertaking seldom end in one grand melodramatic explosion of firework through devil arises in full roar to drag dr faustus forever into flaming pit on contrary devil stand by servant to last try to bring off shattered force with drum beating color flying if possible to lull enemy into supposing that fight be ended long before really be half over good lord howard of effingham knew well knew too that medina have one last card to play be filial affection of dutiful chivalrous son james of scotland true have promised faith to elizabeth be reason why must keep have be hankering dabbling after spain for year past for absolution be dear to inmost soul queen elizabeth have have to warn scold call liar for so doing so armada might still find shelter provision in firth of forth whether lord howard knew not medina did not know that elizabeth have played card cunningly in shape of one of appeal to purse to james dying day overweighed others save appeal to vanity title of dukedom in england yearly pension of pound guard at queen charge other matter probably more hound deer have steeled heart of king of scot sealed firth of forth nevertheless a say lord howard like rest of elizabeth hero trusted james just a much a james trusted others therefore thought good to escort armada until be safely past domain of most chivalrous truthful solomon on th of august fear such a be be laid to rest spaniard left scottish coast sailed away for norway game be played out end be come a end of such matter generally come by gradual decay petty disaster mistake till snow mountain instead of being blown tragically heroically to atom melt helplessly pitiably away chapter xxxii how amyas threw sword into sea full fathom deep thy father lie of bone be coral made be pearl be eye nothing of that doth fade suffer sea change into something rich strange fairy hourly ring knell hark hear ding dong bell tempest yes be over great armada be vanquished be lulled for awhile everlasting war be in heaven battle of iran turan of child of light of darkness of michael angel against satan fiend battle slowly seldom once in course of many century culminates ripens into day of judgment becomes palpable incarnate no longer mere spiritual fight one of flesh blood wherein simple men may choose side without mistake help god cause not merely with prayer pen with sharp shot cold steel day of judgment have come have divided light from darkness sheep from goat tried man work by fire behold devil work like maker be proved to have be a always lie sham windy boast bladder collapse at merest pinprick byzantine empire spanish armada triple crowned papacy russian despotism be way of will be to end of world one brave blow at big bullying phantom vanishes in sulphur stench while child of israel a of old see egyptian dead on sea shore scarce know how save god have done sing song of moses of lamb now from england netherlands from germany geneva poor vaudois shepherd saint whose bone for generation past lie scattered on alpine mountain cold to be indeed seed of church germ of new life liberty civilization even in very day returning good for evil to piedmont have hunted down like partridge on mountain from of europe from of mankind have almost said in lay seed of future virtue greatness of destiny of new discovered world triumph of coming age of science arose shout of holy joy such a world have not heard for many weary bloody century shout be prophetic birth paean of north america australia new zealand pacific island of free commerce free colonization over whole earth there be in england by commandment of majesty say van meteran likewise in united province by direction of state solemn festival day publicly appointed wherein person be solemnly enjoined to resort unto ye church there to render thanks praise unto god ye preacher be commanded to exhort ye people thereunto aforesaid solemnity be observed upon th of november day be wholly spent in fasting prayer giving of thanks likewise queen majesty herself imitating ye ancient roman rode into london in triumph in regard of own subject glorious deliverance for being attended upon very solemnly by ye principal estate officer of realm be carried through said city of london in triumphant chariot in robe of triumph from palace unto ye said cathedral church of st paul out of ye ye ensign colour of ye vanquished spaniard hung displayed ye citizen of london in livery stood on side ye street by several company with ensign banner street be hanged on side with blue cloth together with ye foresaid banner yielded very stately gallant prospect majestie being entered into ye church together with clergy noble gave thanks unto god caused public sermon to be preached before at paul cross wherein none other argument be handled that praise honour glory might be rendered unto god that god name might be extolled by thanksgiving with own princely voice most christianly exhorted ye people to do ye same whereunto ye people with loud acclamation wished most long happy life to ye confusion of foe yes a medal struck on occasion said came saw fled whither away northward like herd of frightened deer past orkneys shetland catching up few hapless fisherman a guide past coast of norway there too refused water food by brave descendant of viking on northward ever towards lonely faroes everlasting dawn herald round pole midnight sun water be failing cattle must go overboard wild northern sea echo to shriek of drowning horse must homeward at least somehow a best can let meet again at cape finisterre if indeed ever meet medina sidonia with five twenty of soundest best victualled ship will lead way leave rest to fate be soon out of sight forty more only remnant of mighty host come wandering wearily behind hoping to make south west coast of ireland have help at least fresh water there from fellow romanists ala for make thou way dark slippery follow up ever with thy storm for now come up from atlantic gale on gale few of hapless remnant reached shore of spain where be amyas vengeance while at fifty seventh degree of latitude english fleet finding growing short of provision having be long since out of powder ball turn southward toward home thinking best to leave spaniard to uncouth boisterous northern sea few pinnace be still sent onward to watch course english fleet caught in same storm scattered spaniard with great danger industry reached harwich port there provide of victual ammunition in case spaniard must return there be need for caution parma indeed who can not believe that idol at halle after compliment to will play so scurvy trick will watch for week on dunkirk dune hoping against hope for armada return casting anchor spinning rigging to repair loss lang lang may lady sit with fan intill hand before see sir patrick spens come sailing to land armada be away on other side of scotland amyas be following in wake for when lord high admiral determined to return amyas asked leave to follow spaniard asked too of sir john hawkins who happened to be at hand such ammunition provision a must be afforded promising to repay same like honest man out of plunder if lived out of estate if died lodging for purpose bill in hand of sir john who a man of business took put in pocket among thimble string tobacco after amyas calling men together reminded once more of story of rose of torridge don guzman de soto then asked men of bideford will follow there will be plunder for who love plunder revenge for who love revenge for of for love honor of having never left chase a long a there be spanish flag in english sea soul on board replied that must follow sir amyas leigh around world there be need for to detail incident of long weary chase how found sta catharina attacked have to sheer off being rescued by rest how when medina squadron left crippled ship behind be taken sunk by thrusting into midst of spanish fleet to prevent escaping with medina how crippled so that must not beat to windward out into ocean be fain to run south past orkneys down through minch between cape wrath lewis how younger hand be ready to mutiny because amyas in stubborn haste ran past two three noble prize be disabled among others one of great gallia two great venetian la ratta la belanzara be afterwards with more than thirty other vessel wrecked on west coast of ireland how got fresh water in spite of certain hebridean scot of skye who after reviling in unknown tongue fought with awhile then embraced men with howl of affection be not much more decently clad more civilized than old friend of california how pacified men by letting pick bone of great venetian be going on shore upon islay by got booty enough to repay for whole voyage offended again by refusing to land plunder two great spanish wreck on mull of cantire whose crew by by james tried to smuggle off secretly into spain in ship of own wishing to play a usual side of game at once spaniard be stopped at yarmouth till council pleasure be known be of course to let poor wretch go on way be hanged elsewhere how passed strange island half black half white wild people called raghary cary christened drowned magpie how sta catharina be near lost on isle of man then put into castleton where manx men slew whole boat crew with arrow then put out again when amyas fought with whole day shot away mainyard how spaniard blundered down coast of wale not knowing whither went how be nearly lost on holyhead again on bardsey island how got on lee shore in cardigan bay before heavy westerly gale sta catharina ran aground on sarn david one of strange subaqueous pebble dyke be said to be remnant of lost land of gwalior destroyed by carelessness of prince seithenin drunkard at whose name loyal welshman spit how got off again at rising of tide fought with fourth time how wind changed got round st david head many more moving incident of eventful voyage must pas over without detail go on to end for be time that end must come be now sixteenth day of chase have seen evening before st david head then welsh coast round milford haven looming out black sharp before blaze of inland thunder storm have lightened round during fore part of night upon light south western breeze in vain have strained eye through darkness to catch by fitful glare of flash tall mast of spaniard of one thing at least be certain that with wind a be must not have gone far to westward to attempt to pas again go northward be more than dare do be probably lying to ahead of perhaps between land when little after midnight wind chopped up to west blew stiffly till day break felt sure that unless have attempted desperate expedient of running past have safe in mouth of bristol channel slowly wearily broke dawn on day a often follows heavy thunder sunless drizzly day roofed with low dingy cloud barred netted festooned with black sign that storm be only taking breath awhile before burst again while narrow horizon be dim spongy with vapor drifting before chilly breeze a day went on breeze died down sea fell to long glassy foam flecked roll while overhead brooded inky sky round leaden mist shut out alike shore chase amyas paced sloppy deck fretfully fiercely knew that spaniard must not escape cursed moment lingered between that one great revenge blackened soul men sate sulkily about deck whistled for wind sail flapped idly against yeo will have plenty before night said cary thunder too so much better said amyas may roar till split heaven if doe let get work done be not far off warrant said cary one lift of cloud must see to windward of a likely a not said amyas devil fight for believe to have be on heel sixteen day not sent through yet shook sword impatiently so morning wore away without sign of living thing not even in accursed heart then strike dead if thou wilt lord have mercy on cried john brimblecombe what have said what be to sir there be piping to dinner go down will not come jack went down talked in half of briton helped to humble pride of spaniard at rio de la hacha nombre first of sailed upon south sea will be hereafter by god grace a free to english keel a be bay outside who having afterwards be
